description:
Hits the spot without breaking the bank. 

I always get the salads when I go to Souvla and I love how the portions are huge and the price is very fair! I can't speak for the pita sandwiches or other things on the menu, but I've gotten these two salads: 

Pork shoulder salad (5/5): the pork was cooked perfectly and nicely tender. I loved the sweetness of the red onions and the creaminess of the cheese in this salad- all the flavors blended really well and if I go back to Souvla, this would be my go-to salad pick

Lamb salad (4/5): this salad was up there but compared to the pork, I think the lamb was a bit tougher and not as tender/juicy. I got a bit tired of chewing after a while and some bits of the lamb were dryer and less flavorful. Overall still a yummy salad that really fills you up though.
author: Joy C.

description:
The line goes out the door almost every time I've been here, but it moves quickly and waiting for tables isn't too bad. The bussers are always on top of it and super quick to clear dishes to move tables quickly.

We ordered -

Pork salad - always my go-to. Tons of fresh, quality ingredients that contrast with each other so well. Juicy, fatty pork, crunchy cucumbers and onions, creamy dressing on hearty kale and romaine. One thing I don't like about the salad is that it comes with TOO MUCH feta. #firstworldproblem. A+

Lamb wrap - The creamy, spicy harissa sauce and well-seasoned lamb are the stars of this. The pita bread is soft, warm, and chewy. However, the distribution of ingredients was a bit off. The pita was so large that you had to eat it in two sections - the top & bottom of the pita. Top was all veggies while the bottom was the meat and sauce. It would have been nice for the ingredients to be mixed within the wrap or even just sauce ontop of the veggies. B

Fries - the fries were overcooked and too crunchy. The perfect fries should be crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, which these fries were not. Some fries felt like we were just biting through crust to get to the oily center. C

Very affordable for the quality and quantity of food. Dinner for two after tax and tip was $40.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I understand the fast casual concept is logical, however the food is so fast that the lamb was really quite tough on their sandwich

I had the same sandwich a few weeks prior that was far more tender, in this instance it was chunks of lamb.

Slow down the cooking process please if the quality is to remain along with consistency.
author: Michael M.

description:
Huge fan of fast casual / counter service in San Francisco and the Souvla chain ranks among my top favorites.  The menu is narrowly focused on 3 types of spit roasted meats (and 1 veggie option I never bothered trying) offered in two forms: salad or pita sandwich.  Much more unique than regular soup/salad joints because the rotisserie meat is simply amazing.  Plus the ambiance almost feels like a full service restaurant.

Chicken Salad: I'm not a salad kinda guy, but I'm totally into Souvla's chicken salad.  They're really generous with the chicken, cheese and creamy sauce.  The fruit and veggies work very well to complement all the aforementioned umami and richness.  It's like you're getting your vegetables, but you're not sacrificing taste.

Chicken Sandwich: I am in utter disbelief that I prefer the chicken salad to the chicken sandwich.  Same central ingredients, but wrapped in a chewy pita.  The chicken is delicious of course and it's really packed in.  The pita is delicious too.  The sandwich just feels really heavy.  I noticed myself missing all that kale from the salad, which does a great job cutting the fattiness of the filling.  Also, the breast meat chunks felt particularly dry against the starchy pita.
author: Adam B.

description: Souvla isn't bad. But it's a little overrated and a little too pricy for the quality/portions of what you're getting. Like the total mix of flavors and sauces in the chicken gyro are solid, but the chicken itself is a bit dry and grainy and at $13 you should be getting some moister chicken. I'm not a fan of white meat generally but you can give it a little more moisture by throwing some drippings back in there. For the old heads, there's an SNL sketch about "the juice" which fits this well.
author: Misha T.

description:
I went to Souvla today and was surprised when there was no line out the door as their usually is. We came here on Labor Day at noon and waited no more than 5 minutes for our order to be taken. 

FOOD: I ordered the lamb sandwich and my friend ordered the pork sandwich. While I actually preferred his pork sandwich to mine, he said that the lamb undoubtedly surpassed the pork sandwich and he would have ordered the lamb if he had known. We also got their fries which were okay, nothing too special. And of course, we had to have our baklava and Greek yogurt (we actually went to the Valencia location after the Divisadero location since this ice cream machine was broken). I'm not a big fan of Greek yogurt, but I would eat Souvla's any day of the week. It was absolutely amazing and I couldn't get enough even though I was so full from lunch. 

SERVICE: good. Nothing extraordinary, but kind hosts and waiters who brought our food. 

If you're in SF, Souvla is a must visit. Their sandwiches are comparable to other Mediterranean restaurants, but their Greek yogurt is unbeatable!
author: Grace L.

description:
To be upfront, I'm not a huge fan of Greek food (and by that, I mean the Americanized Greek that is ubiquitous in towns large and small across the country), but my friends and I came to Souvla after a day of biking and it was the perfect lunch. The lamb sandwich was good! It had a decent portion of meat, with a refreshing complement of crisp veggies. I also ordered the baklava froyo which was tart and delicious. 

The ambience and decor of the shop itself is also great, but it's a bit small. I would not recommend Souvla for large groups. Prices are exactly what you'd expect for a San Francisco eatery, which is to say higher than I'd like but totally in-line with other spots in the area. I would definitely come back!
author: Bri T.

description:
VEGETARIAN REVIEW
 
2 stars for food and 4 for their froyos.


Veggie options are bleak, the salads and wraps have no source of protein. Add falafel maybe? The fries are decent. 

Love their froyo, I mix baklava and cherry topping. Refreshing.
author: Shruti D.

description:
Souvla is hands down one of the best fast casual restaurants I've ever been to! The quality of food is always consistent and the cashiers are top notch friendly people.

I had finished a late workout and my body was craving some protein. I straight up went to their website and ordered a side of chicken and a side of pita. I have yet to try their chicken as is without the tasty sauces they make and WOW, they know how to season their chicken!

Pro tip, order online in advance so you skip the line! You can still eat there with your to-go bag!

This location is bigger than their Hayes Valley location so there is plenty of seating if you're looking to enjoy a meal with some company.

My only nitpick is that the brass tables have a really strong brassy smell, ha! But you'll get over it!
author: Nitar L.

description:
Souvla is amazing, every time.

Their menu is small but perfect as-is. Great for lunch or dinner. 

I love all of the salads. My favorites are the chicken and the pork. All of the ingredients are high quality and always fresh. I've only had the sandwiches a few time but they've never disappointed either. 

The Greek fries are also delicious. I especially love them with the "granch" (Greek yogurt ranch) dressing. 

Lastly, the frozen Greek yogurt is soooo good. Sometimes I come here just for that. It's creamy and tart but not too tart. The baklava topping is a great addition to bring in some sweetness. However, sometimes I just have it plain and it's still amazing. 

During my most recent visit I saw they have a breakfast sandwich which I can't wait to try!

As far as the setting, the restaurant doesn't have a ton of seating but you can usually find a seat if you wait a bit. They have a really cute outdoor patio as well. 

Don't let the lines scare you off, they move quickly and the food is 100% worth the wait.
author: Jessie K.

description: A lot of people I know *really* like this place. I didn't really care for the food. I had the lamb wrap/sandwich/whatever they call it. I expected it to be shaved, gyro-style, which is maybe my fault for making that assumption. In reality the lamb is cubed. Why would I want a wrap filled with cubed meat? Not that easy to eat, and not that delicious. What is good, however, is the baklava frozen yogurt. The yogurt is delightfully tart. I like to get the baklava in a cup on the side. It's like a baklava cobbler, if you can picture that. I like going back just for the yogurt.
author: Neil S.

description:
A few friends and I each had a chicken salad and shared 2 orders of the Greek fries. Delicious and fresh! And the food came out so quickly after ordering! 

Not only was it tasty, but aesthetically pleasing to the eye...rich, vibrant, robust colors! 

There are both indoor and outdoor seating. Indoor was bright, open, and clean. Outdoor patio looked cute, but I didn't actually go check it out. Next time! 

Will come again!
author: Peds P.

description: This place has great outdoor seating, fun drinks, and awesome Greek food. The reason for the 4 stars is that I just find it pricey for what it is and the amount that they give you. I ordered the Vegetarian Wrap and really enjoyed the potatoes and Greek  olives combination!
author: Sydney G.

description: Good flavors, but way overpriced in my opinion. The salad didn't seem spectacular enough to justify the cost. The overall atmosphere & vibe of the place is really cool, though. I see it more as paying for location and convenience rather than for the sheer quality of the food itself.
author: Niki M.

description:
I wasn't super impressed with Souvla Hayes when it opened but chalked it up to ordering the wrong dishes. They've since expanded and Souvla has become one of my go-to staples for a casual meal when I'm feeling too lazy to make my own. The Divisadero location is less crowded than Hayes or Mission. There's a spacious outdoor patio area in the back as well if you like dine outside.

While the chicken is on the dry side, the lamb items are on point! My lamb salad was very flavorful and tender. For fast food, the ingredients are fresh, the flavor profile has depth. The cucumber, radish, and sprouts bring out a freshness that outbalances the heaviness of the lamb. I also enjoyed the harissa spiked yogurt dressing which brought an element of tang to round it out.

For dessert, the olive oil salted frozen greek yogurt is an interesting sweet and savory treat!
author: Truc N.

description:
Salads are definitely basic, but Souvla has managed to put the right touches to theirs so that it is anything but that.

Filled with cheese, crunchy greens, super tender meat and other goodies, you will come hungry and realize that you can't even finish the whole thing...but mainly because you're trying to save room for some of their frozen greek yogurt. Or because you decided to have another glass of wine instead (It was a sunny day in SF and you couldn't help yourself).

Souvla is a 5 star joint because it has all of the necessities - creative twist on a common dish, high quality, outdoor seating with the perfect ambiance, fast service, dessert and wine. What more could you ask for?
author: Allie L.

description:
This Greek chainlet is just wonderful. 
It's quick, inexpensive, healthy, and unique! 

They cover all the important things in a meal- they've got vegetarian options, low carb, gluten free, beer & wine, and of course, dessert. 

You have the option of choosing one of their spit-fired meats- Chicken, Pork, or Lamb- as a wrap or salad bowl. These are generous portions so you won't leave hungry.

On foggy rainy days or when I've got a bad cold, I love their Avgolemono soup- a traditional egg-lemon soup with chunks of pulled chicken and rice. It's creamy and puckery and warms you right up! 

The Greek fries and potatoes are nice if you're still hungry. 
And yes, even the wine and beer are Greek! 

For dessert, you guessed it, it's Greek Yogurt! But it's not your basic store bought stuff- it comes freshly made out of a soft serve machine and you have the option to add Greek Olive Oil & Flaky Sea Salt or Baklava Crumbles & Honey Syrup. I know... I can never make up my mind. 

So whether it's a cold rainy day or during a rare heat wave, this place has got you covered with good food and yummy treats. So go ahead and GREEK out for Souvla!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
I had some time to kill before an appointment and wanted to grab some lunch. It was a little after 1:30pm and they were still fairly busy, but the line went by fast. 

I decided on getting a chicken sandwich and fries. My total came out to around $20. 

I sat outside on the patio because all the tables were taken inside. My food came out quicker than I thought. 

I really wanted to love the chicken sandwich, but I couldn't even enjoy it because there were some pieces of chicken that were pink. But, everything else was fresh. The garlic fries were just ok. 

I would probably not come back for the food. However, I would totally come back to try the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava crumbles and honey syrup!
author: Fallon P.

description:
These folks were so wonderful and lovely to me. I was having a bad day and needed something comforting so I got the soup and a gyro. They were both fantastic. The soup really warmed me and was so delicious. The lamb gyro was tasty and tender.
They were so sweet, I told the nice man taking my order that my bank (Chase BTW) had screwed me over and he was such a sweetheart and threw in a French fries for me. 
Also said to let him know if I needed a yogurt, that he didn't want me feeling so down.
Well it helped and I recommend the food and customer service.  Good people still exist in San Francisco this was a great reminder of that.
Thank Souvla
author: Tiana G.

description:
MY FAVORITE! I loved this fast casual joint. It was fast, delicious, and so fresh! I got the chicken salad bowl and the greek fries with the greek-ranch dipping sauce but I preferred the garlic sauce my friend got with her fries. 
My only regret was not getting the dessert.
author: Parissa A.

description:
Been coming here for years, and judging by the lines no need to Yelp this exceedingly popular, casual Greek spot, but I cannot resist talking up their sour yogurt with cherries, in case you haven't ventured there yet.

Everything here is delicious, although I find their items prepared with lamb tend towards the salty, including their sandwiches and salad options.  Some may consider them well seasoned, but I'm reaching for the water, even with a crunchy, healthy salad.  

But the thing I really can't get enough of here is the frozen yogurt.  It's going to work for those who like the sour variety.  The frozen greek yogurt is delicious topped with the so-called sour cherries in syrup (which are actually quite sweet.)  If you tend towards the sweet side of life, you might chose to go the baklava and honey topped yogurt route, which is also very delicious, although far more sweet. If you are here with a small appetite and know you couldn't possibly eat both a salad (or sandwich) and dessert, then its an easy choice.  Get the fro yo!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Souvla is a great go to place for a healthy meal out, delivery, or a sweet treat. I love their chicken wrap and recommend getting fries inside or on the side because they're so delicious.
The frozen Greek yogurt is one of my favorite parts about Souvla. I prefer the Greek olive oil and flaky sea salt flavor. The first time I had it it was way too salty. I now ask for light on the salt and it is the perfect amount.
author: Emitom H.

description: Souvla is a modern, clean, trendy restaurant. The food is incredibly fresh, and the menu has great selection of healthy salads with different kinds of well seasoned protein. (you can add fries to your salad for an extra dollar, its called Greek style). They are also famous for their baklava Greek yogurt, and I reassure everyone here that it does not disappoint. Would come back again if I crave something healthy.
author: Kaylee P.

description:
Only came here to try the frozen Greek yogurt and wow was I impressed. I hate regular Greek yogurt but the frozen/soft serve style version they serve here was amazing. I got mine with baklava and honey and it was so damn good. The frozen yogurt had a hint of that Greek tang but paired with the honey it was heaven. Definitely recommend this place for the frozen Greek yogurt. 
The service here was friendly. Hey have a cool outdoor seating section in the back. They have a huge chicken roaster up front that smelled amazing. Will definitely be back to check out their regular food
author: Peter P.

description:
Am I missing something here? My friend who got here first told me to skip the chicken because it was a little dry. I got the lamb salad *greek style* so it comes with fries. It was ok. None of the flavors really stood out and I thought it was pretty expensive. 

I wanted to try the greek yogurt but the frequent line when we were done deterred me. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but was really underwhelmed.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 11:30AM and getting a seat was no problem at all. This location seems to be much less busy than the Hayes and Mission locations, which is a plus! They have a front patio and a really cute back patio so you can enjoy the nice weather, as well as normal indoor seating. It seems to be fast casual, so you order at the counter, get a number, and someone will bring the food out to you. 

I got to try the lamb salad Greek style (fries on top), roasted potatoes with rotisserie drippings, and a bit of the lamb sandwich. The prices may seem a bit steep but trust me, the portions are huge and they don't skimp on the meat. I felt like half of my salad was lamb! 

Standouts of the meal were the Greek fries (especially with the tangy hot sauce) and lamb sandwich. The fries are so crisp and flavorful, and the soft pita bread really compliments the lamb/veggie filling well. 

I felt like my salad had a little too much dressing, and while there was a lot of lamb, not every piece of lamb was that good. Some were rather dry so it was a little hit or miss. As for the roasted potatoes, we were really excited to try them but they didn't really seem to have much flavor of their own and were instead just swimming in rotisserie drippings, which made them a little too oily. I think it needed some more salt/spice. 

I'll probably be back if I'm in the area!
author: Melissa H.

description:
Came with friends after dinner and tried out 3 different flavors of the Greek yogurt: the baklava, the sour cherry, and the olive oil and sea salt!

Got to sit in the patio with the heater. 

Oh and the meat from the grill smells really really good- probably the lamb- would love to come back and try it out!
author: Yu-Wei L.

description:
Ok food but pricey. Guess everything is pricey in the city. We got lemongrass soup with chicken and rice.  It was delicious and flavorful. Soup was refreshing n burst of citrus flavors. 
We also got chicken sandwich which was delicious. Nice ambience and may stop by but there are always so many options on d city to try
author: Nidhi D.

description:
I. Miss. Souvla.

I recently moved from SF and I miss it every single day. This place is fast/ casual... but the food is amazing. The salads fresh as they come. My personal recommendation: the chicken salad. The chicken is SO juicy. I promise you won't be disappointed. 

If you have a sweet tooth, get the frozen yogurt with olive oil and sea salt. Whoever came up with that combo is a genius.

My only request: move this chain to NY!!!!!!
author: Paige W.

description:
The backyard is a great place to sit but it's a really tight space. Expect for everyone to hear your conversation and vice versa. 

The food is delicious but it feels overpriced for what you get. My date got the vegetarian wrap, and the sweet potatoes were delicious. I loved my fries, but my chicken wrap fell apart very quickly.
author: Greg L.

description:
I'm impressed with Souvla on Divis for two reasons:

First - we waited only 2 minutes for our order (Lamb Salad, Potatoes) to be prepared. Sure, they only need to toss the salad in a box, but even during prime time and probably 20 orders at the same time, this was pretty slick.

Second - while the space might be tight and finding seating is a challenge, the Divis location makes the most of its restraints by offering patrons a nice backyard (typical SF style!) with heat lamps in the winter.

I find the food okay - a bit of a hefty price tag for mostly a kale salad with some lamb ($14) so I wouldn't be a regular here, but it's a great alternative if you're not in the mood to wait for your NOPA table and instead want a quick bite.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
After a morning of walking around SF, this was exactly what I needed to refuel. I got the lamb salad bowl and it was amazing. The lamb was tender and flavorful. The pickled red onion and feta cheese also packed a big flavor punch! I was full after I ate, otherwise I would have loved to try the baklava frozen Greek yogurt! 

The restaurant itself is really cute, there's lots of light and seating inside, out front, and outback. The only drawback is that there's one bathroom. 

Bottom line: Try the lamb bowl. If you're extra hungry, get the fries on top or save room for dessert!
author: Kim P.

description: This is my 2nd or 3rd time at souvla and it still does not disappoint! I usually get a salad but this time I wasn't too hungry, so I just got the fries and they were delicious as usual!
author: Liza H.

description: Wow I love this place. I've tried all the salads, the chicken sandwich, Greek fries, and baklava frozen yogurt. All amazing. Souvla gets really crowded on the weekends and in the evenings. Somewhat pricy, but worth it.
author: Jane H.

description:
I'd heard about this place from a friend and that's why I wanted to check it out.

You order and pay first, then sit down. This works for their menu as it's mostly wraps or salads. There's quite a bit of seating, including outdoors with some lights if you're coming with a few friends.

I ordered the chicken salad and split some fries with garlic dipping sauce. Unfortunately, I forgot to ask to remove onions so I didn't really enjoy it. Otherwise it's a very colorful, flavorful salad with a bit of citrus. The texture of the chicken reminds me of carnitas, different than what I was expecting.

The fries were the best part! Highly recommend the sauce to go along.

Overall I think the place is great but I'll definitely want to try a wrap next time instead.
author: Monica G.

description:
Souvla has come up a few times as an office lunch choice. I finally decided to see what they were all about on Friday, October 6th. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar around 12:15pm.

*Pork Sandwich: American homestead pork shoulder with minted Greek yogurt, cherry tomato, pickled red onion, cucumber, and feta cheese wrapped in fresh and warm pita bread, Yogurt on the Side ($11)
*Greek Fries: Crispy fries tossed in olive oil, lemon juice, herbs, and mizithra cheese ($4)
*Greek Frozen Yogurt ($5): Baklava Crumbles and Honey Syrup (+$2)

First off, the sandwich is huge! Especially with the huge pita bread. I'm not much of a pita person, so I mostly just ate the insides. Flavor wise, I thought the whole sandwich was a little bland. It needed more than just the yogurt sauce to add flavor. The fries were great! Arrived crispy which is hard when it comes to delivery. I actually used the yogurt from my sandwich as a dipping sauce for the fries. I liked the froyo as it was nice and tart. The baklava was a little hard to eat as it came in a giant clump on top of my dessert. It was hard to break apart and eat with the fro-yo. Not sure if this was due to the transit time, but I could have done without baklava. Glad I tried it though.

In the end, I wasn't wowed by their sandwich, but I enjoyed the rest of the items. Too bad as the sandwich was the main item. Overall, 3 stars.
author: Elena N.

description:
I went to Souvla for lunch a couple of times with my coworkers.  And both times the place was super busy!  And that is a great thing because it shows that they've got good stuff!

Despite being busy, getting a table was still pretty easy for my group since they have a huge patio in the back of the restaurant.

I had their chicken sandwich and avgelemono soup.  Both were delicious!

Mary's Free Range Chicken Sandwich & Avgolemono Soup -- http://bit.ly/2qRqgi0
The sandwich was amazing!  I was pretty surprised how it was stuffed with a good amount of their rotisserie chicken.  And I liked how the mandarins added some sweetness to the sandwich.  It all worked together.  The soup was really good!  I liked the lemony taste of the broth and it also had good chunks of chicken as well.  I enjoyed both so much, that when I came back again I couldn't resist ordering them again.

I definitely plan on visiting Souvla again in the near future.  Although I thought it was a little pricey for lunch, the portion size and flavorful taste justified the price.  I wouldn't mind getting another chicken sandwich or their chicken salad bowl topped with fries which is what I always see my Instagram buddies always get.
author: Rodney H.

description:
I love this place. Their chicken salad is amazing. The frozen yogurt is amazing. It's all amazing. 

Great food. Place is casual, no need to dress up. Just come for some amazing food. It's amazing!!!
author: Charles H.

description:
Quick, casual, and healthy. I've tried the wraps, but I think I prefer the salads. 

I got the chicken salad, which came with just the right amount of dressing. Very large, and they put quite a bit of kale. Takes me forever to eat it. I also got a side of fries which they cook just perfectly. Get the yogurt dip.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's great if you're nearby and want a casual & quick meal.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Two words: baklava froyo. It never fails to remind me of an old high school classmate who told our economics teacher in all seriousness that proximity to a froyo place was critical in helping her narrow down her college search. I'm not sure where she is these days, but I hope she finds her way to Souvla soon.

But the rest of Souvla's food is so good that it makes it incredibly difficult to still have room for dessert. I am a creature of habit, so I always go with either the chicken sandwich or salad. The "granch" dressing (I think it's supposed to be a Greek yogurt-based ranch), pickled red onion, mizithra cheese, incredibly juicy chicken, and naval orange combination is beyond flavorful. In fact, the chicken is so juicy that it can make the sandwich fairly messy to eat, so bear that in mind.

I've eaten at both the Hayes Valley and NoPa locations, but I definitely prefer this one on Divisadero. The atmosphere of both locations is pretty consistent with the same kind of Instagrammable decor found at every trendy spot in San Francisco these days, but it's more spacious here (brownie points for the heated patio in the back!), something for which you'll be thankful when it inevitably gets crowded.

Let's get down to business now: the baklava froyo. It's frozen Greek yogurt topped with baklava crumbles and honey syrup. Don't forget to mix the baklava while you eat to maintain a good baklava-to-yogurt ratio. The sweetness of the baklava and the tartness of the Greek yogurt is a match made in heaven.
author: Amy C.

description: Delicious vegetarian salad !!! Ask to have the dressing on the side - ate on their backyard patio ! Will come back when I am on the neighborhood
author: Anaïs B.

description: Way overrated. Boring tasteless tzatziki. Under spiced lamb. Hey! You can't make up for this by adding a million slices of mini cucumber and radish. And limp pita is maybe okay for the limp yuppies who frequent the place, but give me real food.
author: D.J. L.

description:
Wow these meats are delicious. It's expensive, but affordable for SF if that makes sense? A great meal option if you don't want something too casual or too dressy. I love the lamb salad, fries, white wine (good and strong!) and the baklava crumbled yogurt for dessert. 

Order first, get a number and wait at a table if you can find one, or grab a ledge like we did and stand. 

Love that you can go with a salad or a sandwich. Sometimes we split both so we get the best of both worlds. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. It comes out quickly as well. Love!
author: Guisela L.

description:
My friend recommended this place for lunch so we decided to try it. She's come here many times before but this was my first time! There are two Souvla locations in SF - this one is a bit bigger but not the original. 

If you like gyros this place has such tasty flavors and a great variety! You can choose between a sandwich or salad - both pretty big portions. I ordered the lamb sandwich with a side of fries. Unfortunately, I think I was given the chicken sandwich instead of the lamb because the toppings were totally different than my friend who ordered the same thing. Regardless of that, I thought the flavors were amazing (although it would've been better if I got the lamb). 

My favorite part of Souvla is their Greek yogurt soft serve which my friend raved about. We actually ended up visiting both locations because the machine at this one was broken. This is a MUST if you're at Souvla. The Greek yogurt with baklava crumble and honey syrup was so good. The yogurt itself is pretty good but the baklava crumble takes it over the top! I would highly recommend.
author: Mika O.

description: Healthy greek. Kale and lamb and light on dressing  but good olive oil.  Do it yourself.  Order find a seat, salad in a tin bowl (less breakage in dishes) or wrap.  Very simple . Order yogurt and they give you a receipt for later pick up.  I had the Greek yogurt with the best honey.  If i was winnie the pooh, i would be very satisfied.  Staff are very friendly and fast.  Whole chicken for 24.00.  They are not skimppy  with the chicken in chicken salad.  Get tour own water and glass cup.
author: Helen L.

description:
I've wanted to try Souvla for a while, and now that they have 3 locations throughout SF, it's easier than ever to grab a bite of delicious Mediterranean food. 

I stopped by the NoPa restaurant on a Saturday night and it was crowded, but I was still able to grab a seat. This place is classy, yet casual -- you order your food at the counter, receive a number, sit down, and wait for your food to be served. Despite the casualness, the restaurant is chic, bright, and airy and the NoPa patio is oh so dreamy! 

The prices are super reasonable by SF standards -- $11-13 for an entree. I ordered the pork shoulder pita sandwich and my dining companion ordered the lamb pita sandwich. Both meats were tender and seasoned to perfection. The pita sandwich is quite substantial and I couldn't even finish mine (probably because I couldn't stop snacking on the Greek fries!!). The frozen Greek yogurt looked tempting, but I was too full after eating dinner here to order any. So of course I had to came back the next day for frozen Greek yogurt topped with olive oil and sea salt. It was delightful and I'm convinced it's the perfect snack!

Everything I tried at Souvla was incredible. I definitely think this restaurant is worth the hype.
author: Elyse W.

description:
I love souvla- and so does all of my friends and family. I am glad I was able to take advantage of it before I moved to NYC, and also make sure I go there when I'm in San Francisco. 

This location is my favorite, it's slightly bigger than the one in Hayes Valley. Cute outdoor patio with heat lamps, so pretty good year round. 

I always get their chicken salad- the citrus, and kale mix is delicious. Also I've had their gyro before, and it's pretty good too. Their fries and potatoes are to die for. To top it off- don't forget to get their frozen yogurt with baklava. Pro tip- split everything with a friend, because I always have leftovers!

We need Souvla in NYC!
author: Tahima B.

description:
Souvla is quickly becoming my new favorite spot in the city for fresh, wholesome food - without a long wait.

I had some friends in town who had brought their dog with them. We were trying to find a spot in the city that had quality organic food with an outdoor seating area. Souvla was the perfect place. 

There was no wait and we easily found an outdoor table. They even brought out some water for my friends' dog.  The ambiance inside this particular location is lovely for any and all occasions. In addition to some front outdoor seating, they also have a back outdoor patio with heat lamps, which I saw a number of families enjoying.

At this particular Soulva, you order at the counter (their menu is simple and easy to order from.) and they have a swift team of staff that brings you out your dishes. Everything came out quickly and correctly.

My husband couldn't stop eating the fries and potatoes - lavishly drizzled in authentic Greek olive oil. My friends couldn't stop gushing about the quality of the meat and salad ingredients. And everyone's eyes beamed in delight as they enjoyed Souvla's decadent Greek Yogurt.

For superb - quick food - made with love and outstanding ingredients - Souvla is beyond what's up.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: I've decided that Mediterranean food is my absolute favorite and for good reason. The location was full but there was still seating outside. I got the Greek fries and the Greek yogurt, both of which were good. I ordered both at the same time, but the employee asked if I wanted my yogurt later. I came back to the counter with my receipt and got the yogurt with cherry syrup. I will assume the rest of their food is amazing because it looked delicious and they did have meat on a spit.
author: Julie L.

description:
With the increasing prices and smaller food portions, I have to bump Souvla down, or at least this location. The Divis location definitely skimped out on portion size compared to the Hayes Valley location, and with the amount of time spent waiting for a salad and the increasing prices, it's come to my realization that Souvla is now being put on my "if someone else is paying" list.

Don't get me wrong. The food is still good, but I just can't bring it to myself to recommend Souvla to friends if the bang-for-buck value isn't there. At the end of the day, it's a very simple recipe (chicken salad is just strips of chicken + greens + red onion + some fruit in greek yogurt/olive oil dressing) that you can recreate for a fraction of the cost.
author: Arezou A.

description:
I have had a lot of friends rave about Soulva before and now that I've had it, I'm one of the ravers.  

I had the lamb sandwich which did not disappoint.  The fries were really tasty too.  I was impressed and completely downed them.  We were torn about potentially getting dessert but I'm so glad we did as it was the highlight of the meal.  We had the yogurt with baklava crumbles and it was so so good.

A cool atmosphere with friendly service, a limited but great menu and out of this world dessert makes Soulva a must to try out.

I know I'll be making a trip just for the frozen yogurt again.
author: Blake B.

description: I was introduced to this place by a friend, and am glad I was! The limited menu makes it easy to decide what to get. I got the pork in salad form, my dining companions each opted for the chicken (one in sandwich, one in salad). The salad was hearty and well dressed, with generous portions of pork. It was pretty tasty, and very filling! We also shared the fries and added a garlic dipping sauce for $1. The fries were also very good--crisp and herby. Parking can be a challenge but otherwise a gem and I will be back.
author: May L.

description:
I was having a super bad day and just wanted a glass of wine with some decent food. Popped by around 4pm on a Thursday and it wasn't busy at all. I've been to all of the Souvla locations and love this one the best as it has the outside patio and is so much bigger than the others. 

Service - awesome. The guy behind the counter was super nice and talkative. 

Food - I got their chicken wrap with fries inside (yes, you can do this) and I got a glass of wine. Also added a harissa yoghurt dip as it's the bomb. Their food is always super good! If it's your first time, try their fries and a frozen yoghurt. My fav is the cherry as the baklava is kinda heavy.
author: Mira B.

description:
We originally tried to go to the Souvla in Hayes but it was packed, literally a line doors down from the actual restaurant. This souvla in Divis was perfect because they had a big enough spot for guests to find a table to sit and the line wasn't ridiculously long 

My cousin & I have been craving an authentic gyro but souvla is more that that - the pork is tender and perfectly cooked, melts like butter in your mouth. I may even dare to say it's better than a gyro in Greece. The gyro is HUGE, I'm honestly surprised I finished the whole thing. March it with some Greek fries and you're all set. If you're going to get the ice cream, go big or go home - get baklava and vissino or you're missing out!

The only negative thing that I noticed is the staff seemed pretty grumpy being there.
author: Angella G.

description:
First timer here and I instantly became a fan of this place! My friend, who's a San Francisco native, took me here so I didn't know what to expect. But I loved almost everything about this place!

Definitely a hole in the wall! I guess it's normal, but restaurant is located right underneath a home! AMAZING. This place is definitely aesthetically cute from the inside seating area where you can look out the window to people watch while you eat, to the seating in the backyard looking area. We went when it was sunny weather so sitting outside was AWESOME. 

Downsides: Definitely the price. But hey, it's SF right? For just myself I spent around $23 - salad and fries! Not the most cheapest but I loved my salad. The portion was actually really large! Which I surprised about. I even had leftovers. The place is very tight. But that's a given. If you're in a large group, not the funnest place to walk through. But if it's just yourself or a date or something, PERFECT place. It's just such a relaxing place to be at for some reason. 

Overall a great experience for me. I don't often go to places like this but this was such a cute hole in the wall kinda place. Very clean, friendly staff, and relaxing place to be at. If you have room in your belly for some yogurt, don't forget to try it with Baklava. I don't like Baklava much, but theirs is frikkin delicious! Their meat - I got lamb - was so tasty and I felt so healthy and good eating it in a salad form (: Their garlic fries are also really good, but I think I could've lived without them lol. BUT their ranch was actually the topper. I don't know what ranch I got, but it's definitely not normal ranch lol. SO GOOD!
author: Jamaica B.

description:
***DISCLAIMER: I did not get to eat here.***

I have had Souvla bookmarked for months, if not over a year at this point. We thought it would be elimination diet-friendly (something I'm going through right now), but we learned otherwise as we were ordering.

Souvla marinates their chicken with feta, so if you're dairy-free, eating here is a no-go.

This review is a placeholder - I'm sure I'll come back for a proper meal soon. Everything else looked amazing; the interior is adorable, there's even seating outside, and the visible rotisserie chickens grilling are reminiscent of Europe (my other home).
author: Nic Z.

description:
Very impressed by this restaurant. I stopped by before a concert because my friend and I were looking for a quick bite to eat and this place just so happened to be down the block from the venue.

I tried the pork shoulder wrap and I wasn't disappointed. All the ingredients were very complimentary and it was decently priced for the amount of food you receive. Very filling, I couldn't finish my meal! Also, the service was great because I got my food in a short amount of time despite how packed it was. The woman taking my order was very patient and willing to answer any questions I had about the menu which was highly appreciated.

The restaurant has a lot of seating. They even have a cute patio area in the back of the restaurant if the indoor seating is full. There is no parking lot so be prepared to park on the street. It was definitely worth coming here and I am looking forward to going back!
author: Jireh O.

description:
Souvla is my go-to for a quick, feel-good, refreshing meal.

The Souvla on Divisadero is my favorite because it has a cute (but small) back patio, and it's super accessible for residents of Lower Haight/Alamo Square/NoPa. I love both the white sweet potato salad and the chicken salad, though as a meat-eater, I tend to pick the latter more often since I find it slightly more filling. 

My real favorite dishes at Souvla, though, are of course the Greek fries (+a side of Greek yogurt dipping sauce--worth the extra cost) and their baklava-topped Greek froyo. The super sweet baklava pairs so perfectly with the tart froyo base. While Souvla offers other solid variations of their froyo (that I have tried), when given the choice, why would you ever choose an option that DIDN'T come topped with baklava?
author: Kelly R.

description:
Love the chicken or lamb salad from Souvla. Also can't go wrong with the wraps. One pro tip is to go with the veg salad and add chicken. White potatoes also a great addition.

Their hot sauce is also super good.
author: Ken M.

description:
Amazing Souvlaki, be sure to try their Greek Fries ! 

As someone who often goes to Greece I can easily say that this place gets it right, especially if you're looking for something fast and delicious.
author: Christopher K.

description: I'm Greek and it passes my test  They have definitely put a modern twist on souvlaki/gyro which I love and the option to have it in a pita or a salad is brilliant. They also don't short you on wine when you order a glass - it is a generous full glass. The French fries are great and the potatoes are spot on although they could stand to add some lemon. The soft serve yogurt with honey, baklava or sour cherry is BOMB and a light refreshing dessert to end your meal. It's fast too. You order at the counter and get your meal within 5 minutes. I've been twice now and have not been disappointed. Yassou!
author: Stefanie K.

description:
I stopped into Souvla for a quick lunch after my exhausting adventure at the DMV. I got the pork shoulder sandwich and while I was waiting for it, I had my dessert of Greek frozen yogurt with honey.

I like the welcoming décor of Souvla and the fast-casual environment. I had only been to the one in Hayes Valley before and I think I might like this location more. 

As I was finishing up the Greek frozen yogurt, the sandwich came. I devoured it quickly. It was so satisfying.
author: Yi Z.

description: I had the lamb sandwich and the lamb was so juicy and tender. Best cooked lamb I can't wait to try the other meats. The flavor was so good it's no surprise why the place gets crowded in the evenings! I didn't have room for the frozen yogurt because the portions are well worth the price but I will be back to try it!!
author: Erica H.

description: The veggie salad is definitely worth the $12. Those crazy sweet potato are bomb!! It's super filling yet healthy! Cute interior and back outdoor eating area. Customer service was nice too!
author: Robby T.

description: Good spot! Met some friends here and it was a really good time! Good, fresh ingredients, delicious fries, nice drinks, all around great place for a bite!
author: Kenna S.

description:
Love this spot. Everything is amazing. The soup is one of my favorites. I've tried most of the menu and it's all been great. The space is clean, service good, prices good. 

Requests would be larger glasses for water and bigger pitchers of water and cold water. Also, fry flavor and dips included with the fries.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Souvla is such a talked about San Francisco institution that I'm a bit embarrassed to say that I hadn't tried it out until now. My friend and I hit this location up on a weekday for lunch and were pleasantly surprised to find that it has a gorgeous back patio! The weather was a mix of chilly and sunny so we opted to sit outside and enjoy the greenery and sunshine. So in terms of leaf eater options, there's only really the sweet potato or other sides. I went with a roasted sweet potato sandwich and opted to grab some Greek fries on the side as well. So full disclosure, I actually do not like sweet potato very much. However, I always feel like I should give it a chance because you can prepare it so many different ways and maybe one way will click with my palate. Unfortunately, the sweet potato at Souvla was more on the sweet side than I'd like. I found it hard to finish my sandwich because I couldn't get past how sweet the overall taste was. If you like sweet potato, you will most likely love this sandwich and appreciate it wholeheartedly. If you're a sweet potato avoider like me, you may want to skip it. 

You may be wondering at this point how I could rate this place a 4.0 when I didn't even like the sandwich. Well you see, there's nothing I love more in this world than french fries, especially if they are done amazingly well. Souvla KILLED it in terms of having some of the best fries I have ever had. They were crispy, flavorful, and delicious without being too oily. They're also served with a dip (you can choose from a list) and my friend and I chose the garlic one which was an amazing decision.  

My friend ordered the lamb sandwich and juicy potatoes. If you a strict vegetarian, keep in mind that these potatoes sit under the meat and are covered in the rotisserie drippings. Because of this, I didn't eat the potatoes. However, my friend did tell me that they were good, but not as good as the fries.

Service was great when we ordered and my overall experience was great, minus the sweet potato. I am definitely going back for those fries and will most likely grab some yogurt on my next trip.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
My friend and I came for lunch on a Tuesday.  Found street parking near Alamo Square and walked over to the restaurant.

Ordering process - paper menu at the counter.  Peruse it and then place your order.  Pay and find a seat with your order #.  Your food is brought to your table.

We both ordered the grilled lamb salad and one order of fries.  The salad portion size was humongous. Fresh greens.  Could have fed two people easily.     And the fries were very generous.  Nice and crispy.

Indoor and outdoor patio seating. It was a nice sunny day so I said lets sit outdoors.  Within a couple of minutes at the table, I'm attacked by two ants.  Yes, I'm always an insect target.  With that, we moved inside.

Plenty of self served tap water.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Driving down Fulton St., I was thinking about something sweet to nibble on, specifically Chocolate Cake from Whole Foods.  Since I missed the turn to Whole Foods, Souvla came to mind so I made a quick right turn and headed to Divisadero towards Soula's new home.  

I remember a fellow IGer mentioning this place for their fries but since I was all french fried out for the day, I opted for their yogurt.  

-Baklava Crumbles & Syrup - When you think baklava, you think layers of filo and honey and everything sticky but this was everything but.  The sourness, but very subtle, from the yogurt was well balanced with the baklava crumble.  I love me some crumble and this reminds me of those pies topped with a mountain of crumble...the only part of the pie i eat, and the crust.  At first, I didn't think one scoop would be enough for the huge cup of yogurt but it was, phew!

Lots of seating, friendly service, yummy yogurt
author: Linda N.

description:
This place could absolutely be 5 stars with a few little changes. The food was great and the restaurant was clean, and well decorated. There is a nice outdoor patio in the back with seating. I was even surprised that we were able to get seats after waiting in line to order for 15 minutes. This is a counter service restaurant where you order and pay up front, then wait for available seats while they bring your food.

The two things that keep this from a 5 star review are the service, and the counter service checkout tipping options. I am not a fan of tipping with options of 15%, 20% and 25% before I receive any service. I will happily tip well when I get great service, but I didn't get to judge that before tipping. Also, the service was barely ok. We had to ask for several things and we were quickly served and then discarded. When we asked for hot sauce, a server came over, then snatched a bottle of an adjacent table without a word, then walked away. We had to apologize to the other table on behalf of the rude server. 

On to the good. The food was excellent. The small greek salad was a very tasty appetizer, the fries were crisp and fluffy on the inside. I recommend the garlic dipping sauce for the fries. They offer 4 options if I remember correctly. Also, save room for their greek frozen yogurt. It was a wonderful combination of sweet and tangy. I ordered the option with baklava crumbles, but found it to be a little on the sweet side. I would try a different option next time, but I absolutely wouldn't miss out on this treat.
author: John W.

description:
Great location and environment. Quick service and good food. This is probably the restaurant I frequent most for a more casual meal with friends. I love getting the lamb sandwich, but it is also good as a salad. I can also usually make two meals out of one entree.

The frozen yogurt with baklava is the best thing on the menu though!
author: Lauren A.

description:
I've seen so many aerial shots of Souvla, and I've always thought of it as just another gentrified place with colorful salads and enticing-looking swirls of frozen Greek yogurt. Although I still do feel like it's quite gentrification-y, I found myself quite satisfied with the food (and enticed by the Greek yogurt P:)

TL;DR - Tasty California-Greek fast-casual, but so expensive! Wraps are $10 veggie, $11 pork, $12 chicken, $13 lamb. +$1 for the salad. I probably subconsciously gulped with each extra dollar I noticed as I scanned the menu. We ended up spending $30 for a quick lunch for two o.O

The CHICKEN SALAD turned out to be hearty and surprisingly filling. I liked the kale base, though the random pieces of romaine seemed out of place. Overall, the citrusy navel orange, sweet pea shoots, mildly pickled red onion, and decadent mizithra cheese shavings created a delicious, well-rounded salad. I wish I asked for less dressing (it's "Granch", tasted identical to ranch; would have much preferred a healthier yogurt based sauce like all the other choices). I appreciated the generous portions of roast chicken, but it was too salty and dry in my opinion. I had trouble finishing it towards the end because it was so salty! But I guess the healthiness from the kale and free-range chicken balances out the negative health effects of all the salt :3

I also took a bite of the boo's PORK SANDWICH. As you are greeted by rows of rotisserie pork shoulder with salivation-inducing aroma at Souvla, I was excited to try this slow-roasted pork. It had good flavor, but like the chicken, I found it way too salty. 

Despite my complaints of the saltiness, the famous frozen Greek yogurt comes to the rescue for a dessert of redemption. We got the CRETAN WILDFLOWER HONEY YOGURT (because I'm too cheap to pay an extra dollar for the baklava crumbles :) and it was magical. The tart yogurt paired excellently with the sweet, floral honey. It reminded me of Shake Shack's frozen custard, only healthier and lighter. The consistency was also perfect, not too frozen and not too melty while we devoured it. 

One thing about their food that was unexpected is the lack of hummus. Seeing that it's such a big health food trend, I think their menu would benefit from some hummus spreads and sauces. (They could even use Costco/mass-produced hummus, and no one would really know!)

The space is picture-perfect--olive wreaths on the walls, wooden tables, metal stools. Service is also very fast; the food arrives in no time after you order. 

The verdict? Kale salads, free-range chicken, Greek yogurt, hefty prices, Pinterest-like decor, and inclination for aerial Instagrams scream gentrification, but the frozen greek yogurt... I'm sold.
author: Edna C.

description:
The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. As it is my first time here the gentleman in the front guided me through the process. I ordered the salad with lamb and a bottle of water. Total = $25. 

The vegetables in the salad were fresh, crispy and quite tasty. The lamb on the other hand was an abomination. It was WAAAAAYYYYY over cooked. The provider of this meat was probably the oldest "lamb" in mutton history. The taste and texture reminded me of trying to eat a spoonful of carrot pulp from a juicer. (You've had to have tried it to understand the analogy). 

I would have given a lower rating but for the staff.
author: Scotty S.

description:
I SO LOUV SOUVLA. Get it? I tried.
but really, I do love Souvla. 

It has consistently satisfied my daily nutritional needs and filled my empty soul with joy. I've tried most of the items on the menu, and think I like the vegetarian salad the best. There are sweet potatoes in them! The soup I got last time was a bit salty, but forgivable because it is souvla. Everything is great or above great, so you can't really go wrong. Large portions, good flavor.

I would definitely recommend the greek frozen yogurt. The baklava one t is really good, and so is the sea salt and olive oil one - despite the description. The other ones are just OK.

I would go for the sea salt! Somehow the salt balances out the sweetness of the yogurt and makes it easier to devour barbarically like a gluttonous savage that I occasionally transform into during dessert time.
author: Juliana P.

description: I absolutely loveeeeee the food here!! I could eat the chicken salad every day if I had to :)
author: Hanna K.

description:
The vegetarian sandwich/pita just doesn't work. Maybe they wanted to be different and not do falafel but now I know why most Mediterranean restaurants do falafel for their veggie option. The sweet potato comes in a giant slice and it's a strange flavor profile with the salty kalamata olives, sour red onions, salty cheese and random pea shoots. 

My friends liked their lamb sandwich and chicken salad but I didn't even finish my sandwich.

Cute space and love the backyard!

2.5 stars
author: Ninette C.

description: Love this spot. Very yummy.  Lamb salad 'greeked" is off the chain.   Dessert is perfect, healthy and delicious all in one.  Great for a late night sweet tooth dessert and not feel guilty after you've scarfed down the entire thing.
author: Elaine v.

description:
I can't wait to go back! I had several places bookmarked before my weekend in the Bay and Souvla was first on my list! Hubs wasn't hip on the idea of Mediterranean since he goes on business trips there and has had his share of it. 

I dragged him here anyway and he was just as pleased as I was! We ordered the pork shoulder sandwich, fries and salad. The sandwich was huge, we shared it and still couldn't finish it! The fries were mediocre, I think I'll order the juicy potatoes next time. The salad was delicious. With feta, olives, cucumber, romaine, tomatoes, and kale. Both the sandwich and salad was on point! 

The cashier was friendly and the service was fast! We dined outside in their urban landscaped patio. I'll definitely make a return trip if I'm in the area! Delicious, fast, fresh and healthy food!
author: Micki M.

description:
With New Year's having just passed, I'm sure we're all still keeping with our resolutions to eat healthier and to lose those extra pounds we've been lugging around.  To be sure, it's not easy to stay disciplined with hitting the gym and eating healthy, but it's definitely a lot easier when you can eat salads as delicious as Souvla's!  Yes, they may not be the healthiest ones out there, but HEY...it's better than not eating a salad at all!

Since I've never been to their spot in Hayes Valley, it may (or may not) be better than this Souvla, but I still think this one is pretty damn awesome!  While it initially looks small, there's actually a good amount of seating (they have a nice back patio area).  Most  importantly though, the food is terrific!  The menu isn't extensive (choice of pork, chicken, lamb, or vegetarian as a salad or sandwich/wrap, sides, soup, and frozen Greek yogurt), but I've enjoyed just about everything I've tried.

-- GREEK FRIES - Olive OIl, Lemon Juice, Parsley, Mizithra Cheese (with Harissa-Spiked Yogurt)...$4 (+$1)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco-3?select=Cq2KAO1PJt2ya1V0dyQp4A)
The Harissa-spiked yogurt (which is the same as the one in the lamb salad, I believe) made for a terrific dip, but honestly, it was kind of unnecessary as the fries were PERFECT!  I loved the mizithra cheese and lemon juice, but I was most impressed with how crispy the fries were!

-- SUPERIOR FARMS LAMB LEG - Harissa-Spiked Yogurt, Cucumber, Radish, Pickled Red Onions, Feta Cheese...$14 (Salad)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco-3?select=WGpd-KET4TPSgNiIyImTBg)
Despite really wanting to try their pork, I felt compelled to get the lamb the first time I came here (Greek restaurant and all).  Thankfully, it didn't disappoint!  The lamb tasted great, was really tender, and wasn't the least bit gamy.  What's more, the harissa-spiked yogurt and feta complemented the lamb really well.

-- MARY'S FREE-RANGE CHICKEN - "Granch" Dressing, Fennel, Navel Orange, Pickled Red Onions, Pea Shoots, Mizithra Cheese...$13 (Salad)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco-3?select=S2oIhNemaYa6qs_uX0nu8g)
I was hopeful, given how good the chickens looked spinning inside the rotisserie oven, but it was underwhelming.  While decently flavorful, the chicken's consistency was uneven; some pieces were fine, others were hard and dry.  Still, the rest of the salad was pretty tasty, especially the dressing and the brightness the oranges added.

-- AMERICAN HOMESTEAD PORK SHOULDER - Minted Greek Yogurt, Cherry Tomato, Pickled Red Onion, Cucumber, Feta Cheese...$12 (Salad)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco-3?select=JwqMorJrwBpt0j-jlEB7GA)
My favorite of the three.  Not only was the pork cooked perfectly (crisp on the outside, juicy and moist on the inside), but it tasted AWESOME!  The seasoning on the pork was great and mixed really well with the minted yogurt, feta cheese, and pickled red onions.  Delicious!

-- CRETAN WILDFLOWER HONEY Frozen Greek Yogurt...$4
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco-3?select=uq-i7nkwzkku36Qj6WvMkA)
Unlike what I expected, the yogurt was really creamy and not quite as tart as I thought it'd be (which is a good thing).  Of course, the honey definitely helped with the latter.  I'm not sure how to describe it, but the honey felt lighter and sweeter than regular honey (though not abrasively sweet).  Thankfully, it didn't have a strong floral tinge to it either.

-- BAKLAVA CRUMBLES & HONEY SYRUP Frozen Greek Yogurt...$5
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/souvla-san-francisco-3?select=MLkHkgAHqyl3PGpt0J5NcA)
As much as I liked the Cretan Wildflower on the frozen yogurt, the Baklava was so much better!  Not only was there a good amount of it, but the baklava added a nice textural contrast and had just the right sweetness to offset the tartness of the yogurt.  YUM!

Beyond simply how good all of the food was, Souvla is a fantastic value for the money.  I haven't had their sandwiches/wraps yet, but $12-14 for a salad this tasty and filling?  I paid the same for a salad at Squat & Gobble and it wasn't nearly this god!  Plus, the workers here are all so friendly, which makes just that much better in my book.

Souvla, you probably aren't as healthy for me as I'd like to think you are, but I sincerely hope that I'm wrong...because your salads (and frozen Greek yogurt) are definitely something I can build a diet around!
author: Mike L.

description: I love Souvla. I crave it. I no longer live in the Bay Area and I just HAVE to get Souvla at some point while visiting. The lamb pita and lemon soup are amazing. The pita is soft and tasty, delicious tender lamb, feta cheese for some added richness. Its excellent. I'm pretty particular about greek lemon soup and this one is just really lovely. Great for a cozy comfort meal in SF that isn't too heavy.
author: Kayla U.

description:
I love the Hayes Valley location a little more but giving love there as well. I love SOUVLA! Can you open one in the Marina or FIDI? 

Food is always good, never disappoints. My favorite is still their Chicken Salad and Greek Fries. Soup option does change. Must try if they have the lemon chicken soup. Perfect when your sick, with a refreshing feeling. NEVER leave without their frozen Greek yogurt with Baklava. Dangerously delicious! Services is friendly. Place is clean and this location does have more seating than Hayes Valley.
author: Sandy B.

description:
My lamb salad had pieces of chicken. I ordered dressing on the side and it came fully dressed and my potatoes were missing the white sauce that is supposed to come with. 

I ordered this to go and didn't realize the massive errors until i got home. 
Annoying.
author: Audrey T.

description:
3.5 stars.

In terms of portions and pricing, if you consider Souvla more of a fast-food place, then it's impressive. But for fast casual, it's quite on the pricier side. Not sure if that made any sense but that's how I perceived my experience. The line moves efficiently and the food rolls out with barely any wait time. Fresh food and flavor, definitely recommend the pork. I just wanted more.
author: Ernest L.

description:
May I dare say this is more 3.5 star rounded to 4. 

I came here on a new year's afternoon at about 2.30pm after attempts to visit Brenda's Soul Food & Brenda's Meat and Three did not work out (huge queues outside both restaurants scared me off). 

There was a long line to order at Souvla's but the line moved quickly. It was also easy to get a table after ordering. Food came really quickly, which was a plus. 

Unfortunately, with my expectations bolstered by the overall 4.5 yelp rating, I thought that the food was just average. 

Lamb sandwich - Hmm more of a burrito. Lamb was tougher and dryer than I would have liked. Again with the rating I expected a melt in your mouth, more-ish sort of dish but it fell abit short. 

Lamb salad - quite pricey at $14 but it was a huge bowl. Not authentic Greek but I guess it's modified to suit San Franciscan tastes (they promise to use local produce after all). For kale lovers.

Greek fries - crisp thick-cut fries which are above average but not the best I've had in the city. 

Although the food was a tad disappointing, the place was furnished tastefully, lots of white and wood, like how I would want my home to look like. So 4 stars it is.
author: Lindt C.

description:
Souvla is the bomb.

Came here after visiting Suppenkuche and the wait wasn't too long. I ordered the lamb wrap which was soooooooooo good. Don't wear white pants because the oil is gonna drip from the end of the foil. I saw quite a few people with the greek yogurt cups which looked appetizing but I didn't order.

Definitely recommend this spot.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
In the mood for Mediterranean? Head to Souvla.
This location is less crowded than Hayes Valley, and as an added bonus seems to be staffed entirely with extremely attractive men. The food is also generously portioned and comes out fast, so you can actually be in and out pretty quick for lunch. If you sit in the private patio area though, you won't want to leave.

Chose the lamb salad and Greek fries- salad was super fresh and more than I could finish. Ask to add on tomatoes, and use the house hot sauce. I hear their chicken salad is even better, so I'll probably switch to that next time. The fries with garlic dipping sauce were just okay, wouldn't get them again.
author: Stefany V.

description:
Souvla 2.0 is a hip jaunt which like 1.0 serves the most mouth watering spit fired meats made with Greek love!

The casual eatery lures you in with a warm bar area and a mesmerizing 6 foot tall rotisserie, showcasing the finest MMMeats slowly turning in front of you. The hot blue blaze hypnotizes as the fat droplets pull away from the protein bundle and hit the fires below. Hissssss.

* hey babe, can we have one of those things in our living room?! who needs a fireplace?! *

Ok, FOCUS. 

When you come here, you'll know to order at the counter, pay, take your number and sit down at the copper topped community table. Or if the sun is shining in its full glory, head to the back and enjoy their two-tiered patio. It's peaceful, personal and feels like discovering your own secret garden! (except other people know this secret too and will be sharing the space with you)

Thankfully, the food menu is short and sweet. You can't go wrong with getting the chicken or lamb salad. I almost always get lamb when I see it on the menu because it's one of those MMMeats that I don't prepare at home. Here, the salad is a deep bowl filled with nutritious greens, cucumber, radish, pickled red onions, feta cheese and drizzled with a harissa spiked yogurt dressing. It's an explosion of flavors! :0  and having a mound of shredded lamb leg meat will fill you up fast. 

Don't skip the crunchy Greek fries with a sprinkling of Mizithra cheese nor their delicious dessert. Since we were true yelpers (aka: fatties) we tried all 4 flavors of their Greek yogurt: sour cherry, classic EVOO & sea salt, wildflower honey and the baklava crumbles. Which is the winner? ALL of them! (told ya, we are fatties!) 

I'm enamored with Souvla and now I have more reasons to go to the DivCo corridor aside from Nopa up the street. Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Janice C.

description:
Easy, convenient, consistent. What Souvla is doing isn't revolutionary and it's not going to be the best meal you've ever had. But if you want a reliably good meal, reasonably portioned, and not too complicated this is a great place for a casual dinner solo or with friends 

Lamb salad greek style (with fries) is truly the best thing.

Gluten free friendly !
author: Anna S.

description:
Are you going to see a show at the Independent? Stop by Souvla for a bite before!

Saturday night and we found a table immediately. It was a rainy night, which may be why we lucked out.

Perfect for a delicious quick and, potentially, healthy meal. Hubby and I got veg salads, fries, and white wine. The salad was filling with sweet potato slices and a mix of butter lettuce/kale. Yum. We couldn't resist ordering the fries, which were effing delicious. One order is great for 2 to share. 

We were too full for dessert so we went to the concert down the street. Luckily, the band was running late so we agreed on going back to Souvla for fro-yo. I got the baklava crumble. Hubby got the olive oil and sea salt. Tasty, big portions.

No reservations, easy communal seating. Friendly, fast service.
author: Tanya F.

description: Tasty Mediterranean food made quick! The salads are so hearty and yummy, his is one of my go to lunch spots.
author: Jackie L.

description:
Out of numerous bookmarked food spots to try in the bay, I was especially excited for this one - namely their Greek froyo. However, being an avid froyo/ice cream lover, my expectations weren't too high. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich which was heavily drenched with olive oil. It was kind of a struggle to eat my wrap since it got oily, but I guess that was the point? I also felt like the chicken thigh meat could have been juicier. But my boyfriend enjoyed his lamb sandwich. We also got the roasted potatoes, which was swimming in a pool of olive oil as well. Wasn't bad with their house-made hot sauce though. Although in all honesty, we probably should've gotten the fries instead.

THUMBS UP for the cute outside patio! Minimalistic design with a cozy feel, while the mini heaters kept us nice and warm amidst the windy SF weather. 

Last but not least, that yogurt ... man. Exceeded my expectations without a doubt. Originally I wanted to try the sea salt and olive oil one, but I was kind of sick of olive oil by the end of the meal so I'm glad we went with baklava. The honey crumbs paired PERFECTLY with the tartness of the Greek yogurt. Oh that's money.
author: Winnie C.

description:
Pretty perfect though about $1-2 too expensive. I hope their staff are paid very well with the markup.

I prefer this location to the Hayes Valley one. Food at both is stellar and comes out fast but the real luxury at this location is a beautiful back patio. I love the sandwiches here but the salads are flavorful and come in generous portions. I've tried the chicken, lamb, and pork and all have been great.

Also, get.the.fries.

Gentrification Notes for the Owner:

As with all gentrifying businesses, please hire and train black and Latino people for the front of the house not just the back, give back to the neighborhood (donate food, charity of the month, etc.) and be humble about the people from the nabe who can't afford to eat here but would appreciate the opportunity to work here.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Can't wait to go back to Souvla again soon! I had such a great dinner with some girlfriends this week. I love that they source their meat from providers who care about animal welfare and sustainable farming practices. It might mean things are slightly more expensive, but the quality is so high and the flavor is incredible. 

I ordered the chicken salad---I almost NEVER order a salad because...salad. But after seeing pictures of this one on Yelp I felt it could be worth it as long as I got a side of fries with it. Both were amazing. The salad was bright, flavorful, and the chicken was so tender and juicy. I loved the fennel with orange as well. I have a hard time envisioning this one in gyro form, but for a salad it was awesome. Same for the fries, they were really flavorful and perfectly crispy. 

Couldn't leave without getting a frozen greek yogurt. I asked the server what his favorite was and he recommended cherry with sea salt. Such a good pro tip! The salt really cuts the richness as does the tart cherry sauce. I loved it!

The atmosphere was warm, casual and comfortable. We sat in the front by the rotisseries and it was perfect to catch up with friends. Next time I'll be more patient and wait for the patio in the back because that looked really nice!
author: Sophie S.

description: Great food, a little annoying to find seating. Wraps can be heavy. Find it weird that they charge for the dipping sauces for the fries. I'm vegetarian and their veggie wrap is heartier and more flavorful than any other I've had. Friends say the chicken is amazing. Overall very good and a place I go to every couple months.
author: Umesh J.

description: My first real experience with Greek food. This place does NOT skimp on servings with their food nor their wine. Messy to eat but quite tasty. Everything is so fresh. I feel like my chicken was a liiiiiiiiiittle but on the dry side but not remarkably so. I wish they put more mandarin oranges in there! It's really cute inside with lots of good seating as well. A very simple and cool place.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
I love Souvla!!! 

They have the best salads and french fries in town, and the yogurt is to die for! 

I'm mostly impressed with the ambiance of this location. The backyard is lit up with lights strung across the entire yard, and they have outdoor heating as well. Perfect for date night!
author: Hester L.

description:
The chicken salad is quite good.  I ordered it with fries on top, just to balance out the healthiness of the kale with the fried carbs.

Highly recommend the frozen Greek yogurt with baklava topping.
author: Angelique B.

description: I have been to all of the Souvla locations in SF and Divisadero street is by far my favorite. The heated back patio is great for chilly SF nights. I always order the veggie salad and the greek yogurt froyo with crunbled baklava. Can't go wrong with any of the salads or wraps though. One of my favorite go-to spots.
author: Morgan W.

description: Souvla has done me wrong too many times. I can get better lamb for $5 from a gyro truck than at this place. Ew. And the chicken is always so dry. The last chicken sandwich I got from here had bones in it.... nope. The only redeeming food item at this place is the frozen yogurt. It is really good and that is the only thing I will ever order from here again.
author: Tara K.

description:
I love Souvla! The chicken pita or salad is the best! The veggie option is a close second. Even the lamb is good and I don't really like lamb. 

The menu is very tight, I wish they would loosen up on that a little. Hot tea would be a great addition to the menu. They have iced tea in a bottle, which for SF, is wildly optimistic. Maybe a special now and then? Work with me guys. 

The decor is cute, the meats are juicy (like lean over your tray juicy because I've stained some pants with drippings while I scarfed down my pita.)
One day I hope to try the fries and/or frozen yogurt. I've had a bad Retsina experience, so that one is not high on my list.
author: Nicole M.

description: I love to hit Souvla for lunch. I appreciate that you can grab a bite there late (after 2 pm) while other decent restaurants shut down service. I think you technically have to think about their offerings as fast food, but it sure doesn't taste like it. My favorite item, the chicken salad, tastes fresh and is delicious. Plus, it features creative ingredients like mandarin oranges, multiple types of greens including kale, and a lite but tasty dressing that doesn't overwhelm. Excellent.
author: Victor H.

description: Hands down I have to say the best I've ever had. The salads are so light the frozen yogurt is soo light and tastes absolutely authentic. They are also so generous on portion sizes. Sooo much meat in the salads!! Absolutely amazing. On top of great food customer service was fantastic.
author: Lauren K.

description:
The meat here is just not good. No matter what meat I've tried its always salty and incredibly dry. 
The fries are yummy and the fro-yo with baklava is addicting. But everything is SO overpriced. $4 for a side of fries. $1 for a tiny side of flavored sauce. After paying $13 for a sandwich that has the flavor profile of chalk? No thanks.
I'll splurge on the fro-yo because I'm a self-hating San Franciscan that yearns to complain about overpriced food. But really, don't pay for anything but the fro-yo here.
author: Erica G.

description:
It's hard to get a good salad west of Divisadero, but Souvla exceeds expectations. My favorite is the pork salad--the fattiness of the pork works well with pickled red onion, cucumber and feta. And service here is quick; I rarely wait more than 5 minutes for my food.

The main star here is obviously the frozen yogurt. All the flavors are great, but the baklava is definitely the best. I mean, you get an entire piece of baklava on top of your froyo :)
author: Benjamin A.

description:
This place is really cute. They have a few seats in the front and a pretty spacious back patio. Souvla is fine-casual so you order at the register, you're given a number, you seat yourself, and the food is brought out to you. 

Speaking of food, the Greek fries are delicious! They are crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I love the tang and brightness from the cheese and lemon. The fries come with a dipping sauce of your choice, extra sauce costs extra. 

The sandwiches are delicious...and huge. My husband and I couldn't finish our own sandwiches; we could have split one. He really liked his chicken sandwich and I thought the lamb was tender and flavorful. The avgolemono could have been more lemony, IMHO. 

Their greek frozen yogurt is good, too. Not too sweet, has a bit of tang. If you get the olive oil & sea salt, which I liked, make sure to stir it up to avoid getting a mouthful of salt all at once. 

Overall, yummy food, chill atmosphere, good service. I'll be back.
author: Rose A.

description:
Mediocre gyros at premium price along with a long wait. The highlight was the Greek soda.

If you've ever had a Gyro a dinner in New Jersey just skip this disappointment. Apparently, there are not many good Gyro options in SF.
author: Steve B.

description:
Location: plenty of tables both inside and outside. street parking is difficult and you'll have to circle around a few times. 

Service: food comes out very quickly and the cashier is nice. 

Food: I was so disappointed. I had heard great things and was so excited- but was really let down. The chicken sandwich was really cold and the chicken was extremely dry. Definitely not what I was expecting. The fries were pretty good but super plain.
author: Shelley K.

description: SO GOOD! My food came out so fast! Cozy and chic place. I got the Pork Sandwich which was really good and had a lot of meat but a little to much feta! You HAVE to get the frozen yogurt! It is super tart and fresh and I got mine with Baklava and I LOVED IT! Good staff and decent pricing! I recommend the divisadero location as well. Lots of parking and I came on a Saturday night!
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Came here with a girlfriend since it's pretty new and less crowded than the other location. We weren't as hungry so we split a lamb and had an order of fries. So basically I came here for the frozen yogurt but to my luck, the machine wasn't working ;(

The service was great. It's the typical walk in, order, take a number, find a seat and the food will come to you type of deal. The food came out in a decent amount of time and the workers there were attentive and will come by every now and then and ask if we needed anything.

Next time I come back Souvla you better have my frozen yogurt waiting for me!!!!!
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Visiting from Florida and needed a place to eat after the park. Food is delicious! I ordered a chicken sandwich while my family ordered lamb. We got a side of french fries which were equally as delicious. Everything was super fresh and full of flavor. I liked the use of fresh veggies and garnishes, as well as the fresh mandarin oranges on my chicken sandwich. We also got the baklava crumbles with honey syrup on top, which was AMAZING. The sweet baklava combined with the tart frozen greek yogurt was insane. I wish we had restaurants like this in Florida.
author: Jenny S.

description:
