PURE DELICIOUSNESS. The food here is unforgettable. I ordered the veg salad without cheese and yogurt with a side of Greek fries without cheese. In the veg salad there were sweet white potatoes, pickled red onions, kale, lettuce, a bomb olive oil dressing and some sort of crumbled nut. Each bite was packed with flavor-- I couldn't get enough. 

My friend ordered the lamb sandwich which she described as decent. The lamb was a bit tough; however, she and I agree that the fries were PHENOMENAL. Not too soft, not too crunchy, these babies were the perfect fry. 

As for the ambient: super trendy and modern. The outdoor seating is awesome. Service is fast and friendly. DEFINITELY coming back again.
author: Nicole A.

description:
Stopped by Souvla on a date night with my girlfriend, and it was stellar. The back seating area is outdoors, but even on a cooler night in San Francisco (the kind that Mark Twain raved about) it was toasty, cozy, and well-lit due to the heat lamps and well-placed light fixtures. We sat at the bar seating on the upper level. Seating there is a little tight, but not uncomfortable.

As to the food, you won't be disappointed. We both had the lamb wrap, which had remarkably tender, juicy meat while not making a gigantic mess of the wrap. Admittedly quite the feat. Afterward we had the Greek yogurt with the baklava and honey on top. Would _highly_ recommend getting this. Recently went by on an afternoon stroll to get the yogurt again, and the cold, slightly sour yogurt combined with the sweet, light crunch of the baklava was as fantastic as I had remembered it.

On top of that, reasonable prices all around! Keep in mind, this place gets pretty busy on the weekends, but there are also three locations, so you can perhaps check around if you're so inclined. More importantly, if you're meeting someone make sure you specify which address!
author: Chet A.

description:
Came here last night for a friend's birthday dinner. My observations and impressions are as follows:

Patio:

The patio set up is nice and can accommodate a group of up to 8 or 9. There are two high top tables with three to four chairs each. There is also a little bar with some stools that can fit up to three. 

Food: 

The veg salad is amazing. I added lamb to it and it was a show stopper. The lettuce remained crisp despite the warm sweet potato and toasty lamb pieces (I hope your mouth is watering).  There were so many fun surprises in the salad including walnuts, olives and feta cheese. 

Libations:

I guzzled up my house red wine - it was delectable.  My friends greatly enjoyed the rosé.  You can either get a large 250 mL, 500 mL or a bottle. 

Dessert:

'Cause let's be honest, this is what we have all been waiting for- the greek yogurt with house baklava is phenomenal. My mouth was overwhelmed by this level of pure deliciousness. A solid mix of slightly tart greek frozen yogurt (consistency of soft serve) and a warm sticky muddled blend of baklava. My heart is content...for now.

Stop by if you haven't yet and get your Greek on!
author: Ali B.

description:
I've been a fan of the Hayes Valley location for some time now, I'd nearly always stop-in when I find myself in the area.  This new location on Divisadero is nearly identical in food quality and interior design to the first, and offers the same streamlined menu.  The seating layout in this location is about the only change with various sized tables throughout and patio seating in the back.  

I'm a massive fan of their chicken salad / wrap as well as the Greek frozen yogurt (all variations).  The fact that you can get a glass, carafe, or bottle of wine relatively inexpensively is only icing on the proverbial cake (mmmmmm, cake!)

Overall, Soulva is the bomb - a fast casual greek restaurant that serves consistently good food (plus you can watch the meat cook before your eyes).  My friends sometimes wish Soulva would add a few more vegetarian options, though I prefer a streamlined menu.
author: Tom G.

description: When we arrived, there was a massive line that stretched all the way out the door. To our surprise, we were at the cash register and ordering our food in less than 5 minutes. Service staff provided a tasting samples of unusual sounding wines, and were very friendly. The chicken was SO tender and delicious. The lamb was smoky and amazing. The "Granch" dip was the perfect pairing to our garlic Greek fries! The back patio is a provided a little quieter and cute atmosphere. Would highly recommend!
author: Ben R.

description: This was a really nice restaurant for lunch.  Looks small from the outside but don't be deceived, besides the long counter, there are also seats, way in the back in the open air yard.  We had a group of 8 and managed to get a table in the front. Food is ordered at the counter, after you pay, you bring a number to your table and then the staff brings your food.  I ordered the lamb salad and it was so refreshing, with the pickled red onions and the ample lamb hiding under the salad.  The fries were crispy and the sandwiches were really substantial and reminded me of kebabs.  Everything was served on matching white and blue trimmed metal dishes. And the staff were really friendly.  Overall, a great place for lunch.  Will definitely return to try their yogurt desserts and other menu items.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Souvla is one of my go-to spots in San Francisco and I am ecstatic that they opened a location on Divis. The restaurant is beautiful with a lovely outdoor patio and much more spacious than their spot in Hayes Valley. I frequently visit the neighborhood and new location is a perfect addition to the area. 

I've had the chance to try every salad on the menu and they are all incredible. My current favorite is the roast chicken without cheese and dressing on the side. I usually toss in the olive oil and forgo the yogurt, and the result is absolutely perfect! Although this is my favorite, you cannot go wrong with any salad. The fries are pretty tasty and I have not yet tried the roasted potatoes. If you're interested in the frozen greek yogurt, the olive oil and sea salt is a delicious combination. I'll be back very soon!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Yummy but EXPENSIVE.

$14 for a souvlaki? You gotta be kidding me! The cheapest souvlaki is $11 and it costs a dollar more to make it into a salad bowl. Was it tasty? Yes but I mean ... I think the souvlaki I got in Greece was half the price, greasier, and tastier. I got the chicken souvlaki. I wished the chicken wasn't shredded though it was very moist and tasty. I did love the touch of sweet oranges that added a tang that balanced the umami meaty flavors well. Portion size = rather large! Couldn't finish the pita.

But I mean, this is the yuppy version of the classic Greek street food... served in SF. So it's healthier and you get to eat it in a nice, sit-down environment. Don't forget the fries.
author: Cindy W.

description: Such great Greek food! The lamb tasted fresher than you've ever had before.. because it is! All their meats are spinning in a rotisserie in front of your eyes. The prices are a little high but that's SF for ya.  I like the ambiance inside and LOVE the lit outdoor seating area but it's a tight squeeze for the line and I was looking for a place to put my dirty plate for 5 mins. This is actually my second time here. I went to the other location last time. I never go to the same place twice so you know this place has to be good!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
It's such a nice place to hang out and chill! Love their yard!!! This type of places represents the true spirit of San Francisco: fun, lively, hip, and free. 

And their chicken or pork shoulder bowl/pita is a must order! The meat is more moist than how it appears. Oh don't forget the greek frozen yogurt with sea salt and olive oil! Doesn't it tickle your fancy :)
author: Yuhuan T.

description:
Love coming to Souvla when in a crunch, need decent, filling food fast or when just chillin with the homies. The line is usually long, seats are packed, but the wait time from order to first bite isn't that long. 

Typically order the Chicken Sandwich or Veggie with Chicken or really any meat added in. I know, weird, but the Sweet Potatoes in the Veggie Sandwich are really good so why not. Standard flavor, decent price, good eats. 
 
Try Veggie with meat. Won't be disappointed. ;)
author: John M.

description: They need to change up the vegetarian sandwich option.  Big slice of sweet potato just doesn't go well with a thick hard pita bread.  This place is usually great with the baklava greek yogurt being the finisher that will make your day.
author: Vince L.

description: SO DELICIOUS!!! I'm so glad I walked pass this spot. Had the vegetarian salad. I love it. The yogurt was off the hook.
author: Angelina G.

description: Although there's only one vegetarian option, it is very good! The primary flavor is sweet with sweet potato; however there is some balance of salt and sour from the fries ($0.50 additional cost) and pickles onions.
author: Solange F.

description:
I love this spot. Been here a couple times while visiting SF and the lamb gyro never disappoints. The fries with garlic yogurt are also delicious. 

The Divisadero location has good vibes. I dig the outdoor section out back.
author: Michael B.

description:
Such a cool place,  good vibes. Delicious food. Defiantly recommend it. Very simple menu, straight forward. 

Had the chicken Sandwich and fries.
author: Ivan K.

description: This is probably one of the best spots in town for a hearty lunch meal. Souvla is solely built on the fact that they provide good, well balanced food that also tastes good, and creates a place where people can also come together. I could easily eat here everyday (if my budget allowed) lol because it is literally just that good. Charles (the CEO and founder of Souvla) has showed throughout all of the locations in SF that he really does care about what he is putting in front of people and how his businesses have contributed to the respected neighborhoods (NoPa, Hayes Valley, Mission) and also cares about the people in them. GO GET THE LAMB SALAD GREEK STYLE!! You won't regret it :)
author: Micah L.

description:
Yeah- Open closer to my neighborhood on Divisidero.  There is a LOVELY outdoor patio (that I'm sure the neighboring residents with back porches HATE, but was beautiful, nice lights - a pretty wooden counter a large communal table and about 3-4 high tables for 2.

I got the Lamb sandwich - it was  a teeny bit dry (wish I had gotten the pork!), but overall, huge and yummy. My REAL complaint is with the size of the water glassed. It is about 2 sips of water, and no ice avail unless you ask..just put out BIGGER glasses, or bigger cups - really silly choice with all the other great choices they made about décor.

I was too full to get my favorite thing their magical frozen yogurt (It might have crack in it, is is soooooo creamy!!) with baklava crumbles. So I will be back and just get that and be happy!!
author: Amy W.

description:
My favorite not-upscale restaurant in San Francisco. I could eat here everyday for the rest of my life. I try to bring all of my visitors here - all have loved it as much as I do.


Must Try: The Lamb Salad
This is my favorite salad in the entire world. It's the only salad I crave drunkenly - I usually want to drunk eat pizza, tacos, etc., but this is just that good. If you eat meat, even if you're not usually a lamb person, you need to try this salad. The dressing (just the right level of creamy), kale, pickled onions, cheese and perfect sized slices of perfectly grilled lamb combine to create the most incredible taste experience. I also think that for $14, while not cheap, you're getting a great deal for San Francisco. This salad, which is super generous with the lamb and depending on how hungry you are could be 1 or 2 meals, would be like $25 at Blue Barn. 

Other awesome food:
*The fries are GREAT. Recommend sharing with a friend.
*The frozen greek yogurt is delicious, especially with the baklava and honey. I always lament the fact that I don't have the appetite to get one after finishing my salad. Worth a trip just for this as a snack.
*The breakfast sandwich, offered until 2pm on weekends, is SO GOOD. I tried it with the lamb that I love so much and was so excited about how good it tasted. 

Things to note:
*The Divis location has a lovely patio with heat lamps.
*The line moves pretty quickly.
*You can order wine here in several different sizes - the 500mL is perfect for when you're sharing with a friend but don't quite want an entire bottle.
*If you're with more than like 4 people, it might be tough to find seating.
*Sometimes they offer a brined whole chicken that serves ~4 people. I really want to try this if I can ever peel myself away from the lamb salad for just an evening.
*Have I mentioned that I'm obsessed with this place?
author: Sara M.

description: I am frequently in SF for training, just a couple of blocks away from Souvla and this is my go to place for lunch.  They have convenient on-line ordering, I just click away to order a wrap or salad, make some customization and by the time a walk to their location my food is ready to go!  I really like their chicken salad Greek style.  The chicken is well flavored and usually not overcooked.  The salad serving size is pretty big, I never seem to finish the whole thing.   The line to order and pick up food is usually not too long.  Prices are reasonable.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Simply put this place is the shizz. 

I've been to the Hayes Valley & NoPa locations - I'm partial to the NoPa location because it's more spacious and parking is much easier to find, but the Hayes location is a great off-peak or take-out spot.

The concept is simple, fresh Greek food. And Souvla delivers every time. Find yourself a table, order a salad, Greek fries + housemade "granch" dressing to share along with a few mugs of the Greek table wine for good measure. On your way out, pick up some fro-yo to go - you can't go wrong with any of the flavors, but the sour cherry is my go to.
author: Maya C.

description:
I've been to Souvla around 5 times since the location opened and have to say that, until I had the salad, I thought it was a liiiitttle over rated and over priced. Everything was always tasty, but just didn't call to me like it seems to call to everyone else. 

That all changed after I got a lamb salad to go. 

For $1 more (I felt a little silly paying more for a salad than for a sandwich, is that just me?) you get what feels like a lot more meat than comes in the sandwich. And I think that the flavors of the cheese, dressing, radishes, and onions are way stronger and more complementary when they're not disguised by the bread. The salad is just a superior dish all around. 

It's a really hefty portion; enough to split in half and eat for lunch and dinner for me.
author: Anna D.

description: Souvla is one of my favorite go-to places. Honestly, I'm a little glad there isn't one in my neighborhood because I would spend so much money there! It's fast and casual but still delicious and you can order wine and hangout for a while if you feel like it. I usually go for the chicken salad, but I've also had the chicken wrap and the lamb salad (definitely add fries to your salad). The Greek fries are really good too. My favorite froyo is the one with baklava, it's the perfect consistency and the toppings are in the perfect amount. Combined with the reasonable pricing, it's definitely a favorite of mine!
author: Lauren A.

description: Eat here, its delicious. My boyfriend and I have it for dinner at least once a week. We usually get it delivered and it is always on our dinner table within 45 minutes of ordering. And we live all the way out in the Outer Sunset. The Chicken Salad and Pork Sandwich are my favorite things to get here. The fries are great as well, but its really all about their Granch Dressing. I could put it on everything.
author: Lynly H.

description:
I love Souvla! This is the third location I have visited in the city (first in Hayes Valley, then on Valencia), and I can say this one is just as fabulous as the rest. 

OLIVE OIL AND SEA SALT FROZEN GREEK YOGURT. You can't go wrong with any of their creative frozen Greek yogurt selections, but this one happens to be my favorite! The richness and subtle sweetness of the olive oil really compliments the contrasting salt and creaminess of the yogurt. The Baklava and Honey Syrup flavor is my second favorite.  Must try!

Also, this location is so close to Alamo Square Park, so it is the perfect stop to grab a treat to enjoy when viewing the Painted Ladies!
author: Kyrie S.

description: Amazing chicken salad and of course you can't leave without dessert! The baklava and honey frozen Greek yogurt is amazing! The perfect combination of sweet and tart! Me and my coworkers are already planning our next visit!
author: Shawna M.

description:
Souvla is a casual, modern, counter-service Greek restaurant with a simple menu centered around sandwiches and salads with spit-fired meats. They also offer a couple sides, a surprising selection of Greek wines, and of course, frozen Greek yogurt!

I came here for lunch on a Sunday, and the one issue we had when entering the small restaurant was the noise--it was fairly difficult to find a good place to sit that made it easy to talk, and the tall chairs weren't very comfortable. The food, however, was definitely quality and on-point. I got to try the lamb sandwich, which was cubes of lamb leg wrapped in pita with a yogurt sauce, feta cheese, and pickled vegetables. The lamb reminded me of gyro and was tasty, and the meat-to-everything-else ratio was definitely generous. The avgolemono soup, made with rice, chicken, egg, and lemon was nice as well--definitely strong on the lemony flavor, but a little expensive for what it was. Finally, I got to try the chicken salad, which was my favorite. The chicken was so juicy and succulent, and the salad (which included fennel, kale, onion, orange) was simple and tasty--it went perfectly with the olive oil and the yogurt-based dressings.

Finally, we had to get the frozen Greek yogurt--we tried the sour cherry syrup, the greek olive oil & sea salt, and the baklava crumble, and each of these was delicious. The yogurt itself was light yet creamy and balanced between sweet/sour, and each of the different toppings played together very nicely with the yogurt. Overall, this is a great restaurant for a casual, light lunch, but all of the items are definitely expensive for what you get, and the atmosphere could definitely be improved and made more comfortable.
author: David K.

description: Omg! Sooooooo good! This place is the ultimate bomb! Loved the food, ambiance, and decor. Everything was amazing. Came here on a date night. The food came very quickly after ordering, and it was delicious. I just had to try the chicken sandwich, garlic fries, Yogurt with warm Baklava- what! Oh and the Rose to top it off! Thank you Souvla! Keep on Keeping on!
author: Kim H.

description: Honestly I was not impressed. Food was average at best. The potatoes were swimming in grease. I had to re-plate them myself and dry them off with paper napkins.
author: Marco M.

description: So bomb! Salads are on point! And I love the baklava frozen yogurt.. the tourist is very tart and the baklava compliments it perfectly. This is a go fo sho!!
author: P D.

description: Souvla nails fast casual Greek food and the new location on Divis is dangerously convenient for me. All the spit fired meats are tender plus the combinations of citrus fruits and pickled vegetables balance out so nicely. I actually wish they added more pickled vegetables into their sandwiches. The lamb is amazing and if they ask how you want your fries, have them directly in the sandwich itself. I like baklava and the yogurt version is refreshingly indulgent. My husband doesn't care for Greek yogurt normally but can't stop eating Souvla's tart frozen yogurt.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Nice staff and tasty food. 
You can't go wrong with any salad/sandwich. And don't forget to grab a froyo on your way out.
author: Theo F.

description: Delicious.  Super duper. Stupendous. I liked it. You will too. Wapakoneta River Valley.
author: Bob W.

description:
First let me say I've been here many many times for frozen yogurt and the fries, which are both worth a trip all the way from the Outer Richmond. It's the best frozen yogurt in the city by far. And the fried are perfect. The 2 stars are for my pork salad.

I finally decided to give the main meals a try this evening, and I don't think I'll be doing that again. I ordered the pork shoulder salad, and most of the pork was really chewy and dry, and the pieces that weren't just weren't tasty. :/ The rest of it was good but then... I just paid $14something for lettuce, tomatoes, onions and feta. 

Not thrilled about that. Would have rather had 3 yogurts!!!  Threw all the rest of the pork away. :(
author: Therese H.

description: Probably one of my favorite spots to hit up for lunch. I am super particular about eating out, but this place passes the test.
author: Raija P.

description: The portions are big and everything is delicious. I am not a big fan of the pork salad because it get's too oily. The vegetarian one is my favorite. Must try their greek yogurt ice cream as well!
author: Clara L.

description:
This place is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood. I've tried almost everything on their menu and I can tell you, you can't go wrong. Their menu is simple, straightforward and balanced. 

If you're looking for a casual meal this is definitely a place to go. And don't forget the frozen yogurt!
author: Ksenia M.

description: Mehhh. Not really sure how Souvla has received so much acclaim in SF. The fries are decent but sandwiches are really nothing special and overall average. There are definitely much better places in the city than this!!
author: Tabita P.

description: This place has delicious fresh food and amazing Greek yogurt soft serve. I have tried the chicken salad and it was super good and filling. I almost couldn't eat the whole thing, almost. I also like to stop in here for a quick fro-yo treat. They have Greek frozen yogurt that you can get with olive oil and sea salt, baklava crumbles, or honey. I highly recommend this treat. The restaurant itself is hip and clean. You order and pay up at the front and the take a number for your food. When I have been here the service is fast but I have also seen a line out the door.
author: Lauren R.

description: Favorite fast casual restaurant in SF! Order at the counter and wait with your number at the table. I tried the lamb salad after a friend raved over it and have not been able to branch out to try anything else because it really is so dang good. Greek fries are a great idea to share because you want to make sure you save room for dessert...order frozen Greek yogurt with honey and sea salt (that combo is not on the menu, but the sweet/salty combo is top notch)!
author: Emily F.

description: So filling, awesome proportions. Fries were standard. Struggled to finish my bowl. Menu is limited and wait is long
author: Carrie C.

description:
Having eaten here ~10 times, I had to finally write a review. Souvla sets the standard by which all of these "fancy fast food" places popping up on Divis or other gentrified SF drags should be judged.

You may have to wait in line for a few minutes to get your order in, but after that the food comes out shockingly quickly. 

The kitchen here is a finely tuned machine, and this is reflected in the core ingredients of Souvla's menu (spit roasted lamb, pork and chicken). The meats are well seasoned, tender from slow roasting and juicy. 

You can't go wrong with any of the salads or wraps, but personal favorites are the pork salad, fries+harissa yogurt, and the dank level infinity "juicy potatoes". Enjoy on one of their two outdoor patios.
author: Narek A.

description: Place was packed food was fresh plentiful and tasty. Great service. I loved the vegetable salad with sweet potato. And the olive oil and salt yogurt was amazing t me. My niece had the baclava one and she enjoyed it as well. I'm. It a big meat eater and the lamb was a little to gamey for me I couldn't eat it. All in all a great experience. The roasted potatoes with olive went well with the roasted chicken. I'm craving this place ...... sigh
author: Lika G.

description:
I'm completely obsessed with Souvla - such a cozy spot for Mediterranean food that's simple, but refined. I understand the perpetual line out the door. This eatery is ideal for those who prefer limited menu choices - you pick your favorite protein option (which comes with a set selection of gourmet accompaniments) and choose between a salad or wrap. My generous portion of rotisserie chicken lay on a bed of lettuce, kale, orange slices, pickled red onions a crumbly white cheese, and a lemony homemade dressing. 

Cheers to Nico M. for showing me this amazing spot! It's so hard to find healthy food options that are also affordable and tasty. Souvla pleases all palettes, with other options like Greek fries, sweet potato, pork shoulder, and lamb! I would LOVE to see Souvla come to Los Angeles! We ended our dinner by splitting the Greek yogurt soft serve topped with a sour cherry syrup. The froyo is refreshing and not overly sweet - next time I visit I want to try a yogurt topped with crumbled baklava and honey.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Yum! Was starving and glad I gave this place a try. Clean, nice layout, a little bit above casual but not too fancy. You order at the counter first and then find a seat. There is also outside seating but it was a bit too chilly for us to sit outside. I got the lamb sandwich which was so yummy. You must order it with fries inside- it really gives it that extra punch. Lamb was pretty tender. My only complaint was that the bread was a bit flater than I would have preferred and all the fillings were bunched up and not spread out well.

The avgolemono soup was pretty good! Strong on the lemony side- a greek version of chicken soup. Finally the baklava yogurt was so good! The yogurt is quite tart- as is expected, but the baklava inside was delicious!

Overall- pretty good place and would definitely come back.
author: Vivian D.

description: I LOVE SOUVLA. A San Francisco must. I wish I could recreate their Greek fries. Their gyro is one of the best I've ever had.
author: Olivia D.

description: I have the had the lamb salad twice and both times I was really happy.  The salad feels never ending. No one finished their bowls.  Their fries are good but you need a dipping sauce.  I added their hot sauce to their Harrisa yogurt.  Didn't like the potatoes - but my friends did. I have tried two yogurts- their honey and baklava. Prefer the honey but I might be alone on that one.
author: Madhuri K.

description: 10/10 for the baklava greek yogurt every single time! I've eaten this yogurt about fifty times, and loved every one of them!! Perfect dessert after any meal. Really cozy space, and you can even watch the meats turn and cook if you sit in the right spot! Eating out on the back patio is beautiful on a sunny day, but they also have heaters for when it's chilly. Also, they're hot sauce is amazing! Put it on anything. Chicken salad is also a winner. A bit overpriced entrees!
author: Hōkū Y.

description: I moved to San Francisco roughly 6 weeks ago and I've eaten here at least 4 times! Mostly I've ordered take out, which is insanely fast. Literally, I've never waited more than 10 minutes from ordering time to pick including nights when the restaurant is completely full. The food is always consistent, the wine and beer is delicious and definitely get the greek yogurt baklava. And if the weather is nice the patio is charming.
author: Tarah P.

description:
In SF Sunday afternoon with kids, thought trying something new would be fun.   Soulva felt like just the place.

I had roasted white sweet potato salad bowl: it is surprisingly tasty & perfect balance with fries with mint dip. Others had lamb leg sandwiches & chicken salad bowl.  Sandwiches were very flavored, but the chicken was too salty unfortunately.  Well, we have very little salt in our diet (that might be the reason).

We find the Greek beer there very refreshing, almost like Corona-ish, very light.

We give 4 stars only as it's not really the traditional Greek I'm looking for, just a fun Sunday evening quick bite place in the city we enjoy.
author: Christina C.

description: 10/10 best fries and sauce I've ever had. Obsessed!! Def always come back when I'm in the city
author: Kristina P.

description:
I've been a vegetarian for 20 years, and one of the things I've missed the most are gyros.  Never seen a veggie gyro anywhere, and couldn't think how to make one on my own.

Hot DAMN! then for Souvlas' vegetarian "sandwich," which is a gyro with white sweetpotato in its place.  Coupled with wonderful pickled onions, crisp greens and a fantastic taziki sauce, I could eat it everyday.  And it's fricken cheap!

The side salad is hands-down the best $5 greek salad of my life, and the fries are great, too.  I loved it, my kids (ages 4 and 7) loved it, we will definitely be back.  THANK YOU!!!
author: Cody V.

description:
Now onto my second review of Souvla - continuing from my review for Souvla on Hayes, this one is for Divisadero. 

Came here for lunch today.  We ordered the vegetarian salad and the lamb leg salad. 

Our bowls were vibrant with color and generous servings of vegetables and lamb meat. Definitely a step up from the lamb salad experience I had at Souvla on Hayes. The lamb here were in visible cubes rather than shredded dry bits. 

This location is larger with a sweet patio in the back. There is a large family table, some bar setting and high 2 person high tables along the back. Beware if you sit under the tree, there are many ants that occasionally fall from the trees. Great place to sit if you enjoy the extra protein in your salad and your hair. 

Overall: 
Food/ drinks: 5/5 for salad bowls. 

Service: 3/5 - hard to rate service for a place that has no service. Everything is self serve here. The pro about this location is that we didn't feel rushed to leave. 

Environment: 4/5- great decor, free wifi and self seating, self water service, clean the tables yourself, however music is still a little louder than what's comfortable to have a conversation in.
author: Janice K.

description:
Great food- fresh and tasty - a little overpriced BUT it's is SF after all and I do always feel super full after!
To-go or sit down. Whatever works for you.. options are great for both!
author: Hannah M.

description:
Decent food, but a bit overpriced. Good service, though I was one of two people in the restaurant at the time.

It's basically an upscale Greek burrito place, but the burritos cost $13.
author: Damien B.

description:
Bone-dry pita, shoe leather lamb, and they charge for sauce.  Needless to say, I wasn't going to pay more than I already had just to help choke down this dry garbage.

Turks make better Greek food.
author: Nathan C.

description: Expensive but huge portions. I did not need to eat that entire salad in one sitting, but I couldn't help myself- it was just so darn good. I will definitely be returning!!
author: Shruti S.

description: The food here is amazing! Definitely for the amount of food you get the price is worth it. I got the veggie gyro (sandwich) which was OUTSTANDING and the Greek fries which were pretty good, kinda average (most of the cheese had collected to the bottom, we ordered the food for pick-up). The frozen Greek yogurt with baklava was incredible, the tang of the yogurt combined perfectly with the baklava. Would totally recommend this place.
author: Meg B.

description:
Souvla is delicious. This was my second time at Souvla, first time at this (new?) location. We got the sweet potato salad, which was hearty and refreshing and had a great balance of flavors and textures, just like the chicken salad I had gotten on a previous visit. Oh, and the sour cherry greek yogurt of course. Solid place for a healthy and filling meal.

Also, this location has a beautiful outdoor seating deck area in the back! I lucked out on the day we visited and the weather was uncharacteristically perfect for sitting outside. 

I would love, love, love to have a go-to salad spot like Souvla in San Jose.
author: Jenn W.

description:
My boyfriend heard about this place from his uber driver. He suggested the baklava crumble and honey syrup frozen yogurt. Ever since that day, we never leave without our baklava and honey froyo fix. Honestly, this is the best combination! The baklava is sticky and chewy while the honey syrup adds the right amount of sweetness which counterbalances the tartness of the yogurt. Don't just take my hyped-up foodie style description. Try it yourself!

Oh yeah, the other stuff on their menu is great too. The fries are crispy. The salads and sandwiches are large portions. And the decor deserves to be Instagrammed. Seating is limited to long tables so don't pull a Mean Girls (reference: you can't sit here). There's extra seating outside with heat lamps.
author: Czarina L.

description:
GET THE DUCK FAT POTATOES OMG. 

Otherwise, the pita is amazing - flavorful meats and dripping with sauce. And that frozen yogurt - yes.
author: Ellie J.

description: I am from DC and was told about this place. Had it delivered.  Wow the chicken sandwich was the best I have EVER had.!!  And the spices on the French fries was the icing on the cake
author: Mar M.

description:
PORK SHOULDER SANDWICH! Messy but the best thing you'll put in your mouth! 

The Greek red wine too. Get a bottle! Why not! (wine not)

The outdoor seating is really cute and with heating lamps, always a plus.

The french fries are on fleek.

I'll be back for you, froyo!
author: Kelly G.

description:
I feel like I should give these guys gold stars in addition to the five stars. It really doesn't get much better than this-

In addition to amazing food, they've also nailed the "everyone is a picky eater" thing. I've only ever ordered online and it's so refreshing that a place cares and pays attention to substitutions for an order. It's nothing major but asking whether you want the dressing on the side and asking whether you want extras on your salad is awesome. 

And the end result? So fresh and flavourful. A favorite of mine is to get the veggie salad and add chicken to it, but the lamb salad is also delicious. 

I'd also recommend the greek fries as well!
author: Elliott W.

description:
Souvia looks small. lengthy, patio too? didn't check..

offerings: "spit-fired meats", sides, greek yogurt, beverages (greek). etc.

eats: Mary's Free range chicken sammie(12)
-actually a gyro/wrap would be more accurate.
-"granch" dressing, fennel, naval orange , pickled red onion, pea shoot, mizithra cheese"
very tasty, addiictive, didn't taste the chicken much, just the various ingredients
-menu just sandwich or salad and fries, etc.
-loved it except for the dripping olive oil which was listed.
wrap very leaky, wasn't prepared. leaked all over my clothing.....

drips:
-olive oil slight aftertaste.
-service fab, courteous. upsell on fries, declined, not a fries fan.
-maybe lamb or yogurt next time? or a salad....
-street parking.
author: Victor G.

description: This place is so cute and absolutely delicious. I tried the baklava and honey greek yogurt which was the perfect mix of sweet and tart. I got the pork shoulder pita and boy oh boy. It was life changing.  They are no skimpy on the meat or veggies! You can definitely have two meals with that huge wrap. I highly recommend this place. The salads look absolutely delicious as well!
author: Isabella W.

description:
Pro-tip: order ahead online (via Caviar or their website) to avoid the long lines!

This new place is a couple blocks away from my BF's place who is obsessed with Souvla so naturally, we come here at least once a week... But for good reason the food (and frozen yogurt) is soooooo good! 

The menu is incredibly simple - choose your meat and then salad or wrap version. We love the chicken wrap and even the salad is super good for when you wanna be "healthy" lol. It is a bit pricey I will say, $13-15 for your entree and then $4-$5 for frozen yogurt but you can definitely taste the quality so in my opinion, worth! Also, grab some of their hot sauces it adds that extra kick!

And lastly, omg... their frozen yogurt is amazing!!! I always get it topped with wildflower honey or Baklava crumbles. You've gotta try it for yourself :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
God the new Soulva is GOOD. The space is far better than Hayes, which is small and gets so crowded. There's seating on the sidewalk out front, communal as you walk in and more along a hallway to a wonderful back patio where I enjoyed two meals in the span of three days last week. 

The wraps are amazing, and I feel guilty ordering a salad instead, but the veggie salad is incredible. Perfectly roasted, giant slices of white sweet potato are a genius addition. I also add chicken to it and it hits the spot.

So glad to have a Souvla in the hood.
author: Elena K.

description:
Perhaps a good place for people who don't know what Greek food is, nor that there are still affordable restaurants in this neighborhood where you can get a delicious meal for a reasonable price. (Granted, none of them are on Divisadero.) I'm guessing these people account for most of the positive reviews.

The food was fine, but has nothing to do with Greek or Mediterranean cuisine. Tzatziki sauce? This "Greek" restaurant called "Souvla" has apparently never heard of it. This is typical California "fusion", novel but I wouldn't call it delicious, especially to those of us familiar with actual Greek cuisine. And certainly not worth anything like what they charge for it. Everything on the menu is about priced about 40% higher than it should be. If the prices weren't exorbitant it could be a 4-star place, but at $13 for a salad, no way. 

I had heard the fries were great. It's not true. They're nothing special.

The food isn't awful, but considering the prices, I see no reason to ever come back here.
author: David K.

description:
Okay, the lamb they use on their sandwich is pretty delicious (amazingly tender, not ground/fatty), and that non-authentic sauce is so yummy. That's what brings me back for more.

Have to knock them a star because they're overpriced and never put enough sauce on the sandwich-- it's dry when you get to the bottom. The second time I went, I asked for them to go heavy on the sauce, so they happily charged me for extra sauce, but it was sadly still dry at the bottom.

Heads up to the parents of little tikes, no highchairs here and mostly bar height seating. There's one communal table in front where you could probably cozy a stroller up to, but the end seats are a hot commodity. We skip this place when we have Baby with us
author: Jamie B.

description:
More places should be like Souvla. The price to quality ratio is optimal.

If I feel like having a great meal that I don't have to make myself, Souvla is always near the top of my list because they consistently (1) get it right and (2) don't cost a lot. Trying any other place that costs as much or more than Souvla is usually a hit-or-miss experience. I find myself coming here again and again for both takeout and dining in.

Also, the NoPa location has a really nice patio out back.

I personally like their pork and chicken salads, and their fries are great. The frozen yogurts are also great. I don't think you can go wrong here.
author: adrian b.

description:
I'm lucky to have this place right next to my apartment. The prices can look a little steep but the quality of the food is great and the portions are generous. The salads are nice for someone looking for a healthier option and the wraps are perfect if your trying to grub. Treat yourself to a baklava frozen yogurt for dessert - you won't be disappointed. 

Pro tip! Order online to pickup and you can skip right to the front of the line.
author: Alexandra H.

description: Great food. The seating is always hit or miss but the food makes it worth it. We either take it to go or eat wherever we can sit. I love the lamb. The frozen Greek yogurt is also delicious!
author: Anna H.

description: My favorite spot in the Haight. Best salads ever and the fro yo is unreal. The sour cherry is the move.
author: Roff S.

description:
We live just a few blocks away so this place has sort of been made into home away from home. We often order to go or eat outside on the back patio, when weather permits.
The Lamb salad's are outstanding and the wraps also. Note also the rose wine is great. My sons really enjoy their frozen yoghurts as well. Five star for sure, price quality and restaurant lay out!
author: Beth P.

description:
Love the pork sandwich. Huge kudos to the kitchen staff who have never, ever messed up my order (no yogurt no feta) even on to-go orders. It's amazing! I've never had such consistently good service. Not a fan of the wine here. I've tried it all and thumbs down all around. Also not a fan of the frozen yogurt. But get me that sandwich and the potatoes any day!

Eating in can be a bit of a cluster as it gets busy during prime time. Love the back patio, though. Sitting out front feels a little like you're in the middle of Divis-- not ideal. 

Prices are pretty outrageous for what you get, but the food is good and take out is quick if you order online.
author: Chloe M.

description: I seriously love the salads here. A nice combination of flavors, colors and textures, topped with super yum grilled meats. And the wine generous wine pours, and the cozy patio. A real neighborhood gem.
author: Deb A.

description: Don't get me wrong, Souvla's food is great and the service is quick, friendly and attentive, but $12 for a medium sized gyro sandwich with sides anywhere from $4-6 is just crazy. The food is good, but its still just a gyro. I know its SF and they use premium ingredients but for me I don't see the value. If you're looking for a great meal in a trendy spot and are willing to spend $20+ for lunch this is a great option.
author: Gabriella M.

description: We ordered one pork gyro and one lamb, and they were both awesome. Great portion sizes, and those pickled red onions are to die for! The baklava frozen Greek yogurt is not to be missed! The Greek fries with garlic dipping sauce were also super yummy. Definitely coming back soon to enjoy this yummy spread on that cozy, heated back patio.
author: Lauren P.

description: Generally don't each much Greek food but this place was right down from our hotel. The pork sandwich was awesome with a ton of meat, and we shared an order of their Greek fries. A tad pricy for what you get but really good and fast!
author: Mike P.

description: I LOVE SOUVLA- consistently excellent every time. My favorite location is Divisadero, just due to seating layout and outdoor space.
author: Marlo S.

description: Souvla is tasty, straightforward food and is very consistent. The wait staff is always friendly, even when there's a lot going on in the restaurant. Great neighborhood spot.
author: R M.

description:
Heated patio in the back: 10/10. 

Fries with garlic and harissa dip: 10/10. 

Salad with white sweet potato: 8/10 (a tad too salty for me but there's a generous amount of kale and sweet potato, which I like). 

This is a slightly more casual place since you pay upfront and don't have a specific server. It seems people go just to get fries or one of their frozen Greek yogurts, so you don't need to feel like you have to get a whole meal to stop by!
author: Eun P.

description:
Came here around noonish yesterday for the yogurt and baklava and oh so delicious! Gotta come back and try the other stuff cuz I heard good things. 

On another note the cashier was not very friendly. She didn't use her good manners and customer service. I don't care if you having a bad day cuz that's your job to be courteous to your customers. Besides bad customer service I would still come back for their yogurt.
author: W W.

description: Fantastic flavors and so fresh! Free range chicken salad and greek fries all lived up to all I read!!
author: Jen P.

description: Lamb is halal with verbal assurance from staff!!!! Salad was very filling, and lamb was tender. Fries with the sauces were good too. Only downside is that it's a little on the pricier side, but definitely would recommend this place!
author: Farhad M.

description: My favorite location. Not to busy like other locations. Modern Greek food, garlic French fries - must try. Chicken salad bowl very tasty, has bunch of protein. Great for a lunch or dinner.
author: Liza P.

description:
I want to say I love it because the space was so cool and well designed.But, truth be told the food was lackluster. We had the chicken and the lamb sandwich. They were just ok. I have had better for much less. The fries were even just ok and I love fries.
Also, this is not a family establishment. They had no high chairs available. I do not have young children but, my friends do. 
I will not be returning.
author: Francesca D.

description: Great place with quick and fast service. Ate here twice in my time in sf and enjoyed both very much
author: Joshua A.

description: Inconsistent. I've had amazing food from here, and I've also had very mediocre food. However, lately it's been trending more towards mediocre/poor. Used to always get wraps, and over the past few months started getting the whole rotisserie chickens. The chickens were fantastic for the first five I got. The last four have been either dried out, burned, the last one I had was bloody. As far as the wraps go the meat is so inconsistent, but as of late just dried out, smaller portions. Sometimes you get harissa yogurt, sometimes you don't. Sometimes the meat is moist, sometimes it's just swimming in a boatload of oil. I truly just think they've expanded too rapidly and they don't have enough oversight in the kitchens when they get busy. It's just guys literally throwing things together without any care or consideration for the final product. I normally don't review, but after spending 30+ dollars on two wraps that were skimpy on everything, and the meat was completely dried out, I can't justify returning. Truly disappointing because I used to love the place, however every time I go in now it's a gamble whether you get a good product or not. Never really write reviews and I work in the industry but just had to express my displeasure. I have even mentioned the inconsistency issues with the chef, and he seemed very concerned. However being concerned is one thing, and actually practicing what you preach is another. I'm sure they will continue to be incredibly successful because most people don't really care, but you should save your money and go elsewhere. For the same money you can get amazing food from ragazza or namu stonepot. Also just realized my lamb sandwich didn't even have any of the pickled onions on it last night, there's like five ingredients in the sandwich. The fact that they're missing one of them is a pretty big mistake. I hope they can get their act together and maybe I'll try it again in the future.
author: Victor K.

description: Just visited few minz ago, I'm impressed, the have really delicious sandwiches. Definitely one of my favorites. I had a lamb sandwich. Well come back with friends for the chicken salad sooon
author: Ahmad Q.

description: Great spot on Divisadero for a quick & healthy lunch. Little garden in the back, hidden gem!
author: Charlotte R.

description: One of my favorite spots in SF. They have great sandwiches and salads. Their yogurt is also amazing! I only wish they had more vegetarian or pescatarian options.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Yeah, I'm addicted to Souvla - so what? 

Their salads are delicious, filling, and their online ordering and takeout system is perfect for someone like me who lives in the neighborhood, but prefers eating at home with roommates. 

My favorite quick restaurant in the neighborhood!
author: Lucas P.

description:
This restaurant is a hidden gem. The aesthetic of the restaurant is homely, hipster, avant-garde, with lots of wood and metal chairs. The eating space is small, but beautiful. It is also very, very clean, and kept immaculate. Ordering is super quick, and the food is served even quicker! The servers are polite and inviting.

Additionally, the food is so good and fresh, and very authentic. I didn't know feta cheese, pickled veggies, oranges and chicken went so well together! My companions ate veggie salads and loved them as well. Water is by the tap and unlimited. The beer was also fresh and light, served under the restaurant's name. 

Would recommend. Slightly pricey but worth every dollar. This is a very good restaurant in every aspect and I would recommend it again and again.
author: Clotilde T.

description: Close walk from the park, good atmosphere and food. Small place but cool back eating area outside for a nice day.
author: Drew C.

description: Solid spot for fresh Greek-ish food with a modern twist! The salads are a very hearty portion.
author: Michelle R.

description: Simple menu, awesome food. Love the vibe of this place as well it's a tad pricey, so heads up!
author: Paul S.

description:
quite possibly the driest chicken i've ever eaten - on the most uncomfortable chairs for dining. the french fries were good tho. not sure i'd come back...maybe for the greek frozen yogurt, that looked good. 

ps i told someone (who came to clear our table) that the chicken was very dry, to which he replied, "so you liked it?". OY. 

i should have brought it back. i was hungry. and now i'm home and have a stomach ache; for whatever that's worth. 

souvla, meh and full of hipsters (but what place in sf isn't these days)
author: Wendy X.

description: I wasn't super enamored with Souvla. I got the lamb gyro and Greek fries, along with the yogurt with baklava. The only thing I would eat again was the Greek yogurt with baklava. It was super yummy. The lamb gyro - was tough, and the lamb was cut into cubes (which I've never seen). Traditionally I thought it was shaved. I was just wishing for more flavor. The Greek fries were burnt, and super crispy. Not a fan. I'd come back for the yogurt with baklava though. Worth a stop if I'm nearby.
author: Keriann H.

description: Lovely Food! Veg sandwich, Greek Fries, harvest salad, and yogurt with sour cherry sauce we all fantastic!
author: Karen R.

description:
All around solid mediterranean spot that is legitimately ALWAYS busy. 

Great for:
-Quick salad, my go to- sandwich, reasonably healthy, good flavor, not dirt cheap, but cheap enough.

I get Souvla probably once every other week. 
Go to - chicken sandwich and fries.
But, the salad is a great option and you know the chicken is fresh considering the roitsseries swingin' right there front and center. 
Tip:
-Get hot sauce and/or the harissa or mint yogurt 
-Soup is good, very intense chicken flavor but that's the good stuff right? 


One gripe, you have to pay for hot sauce which is always kind of annoying.
author: Naveed B.

description:
Simple menu, healthy & fresh, usually a long queue but fast service, friendly staff, modern & fun ambiance. 
Def recommend getting the bottle of white wine from Santorini - tastes mineral, dry, crisp & buttery
author: Mayse I.

description:
My mother and I were walking by when the waft of succulent meats drew our attention. We didn't know this place existed but we're sure glad we stumbled upon this place. After just one visit we're eager to come back to try different menu items. This time we tried the chicken gyro sandwich, Greek fries and the white sweet potato salad. We shared our orders and we couldn't be happier. The salad was generously portioned and very fresh, offering a distinct flavor from typical salads found elsewhere in the area. The chicken gyro sandwich was very fresh and delicious, also generously portioned with plenty of tender chicken breast meat in it. The fries were also really good, nice and crispy and seasoned very well. 
We came at a good time, relatively early so tables were readily available, although we noticed the place filled up fast. There's outdoor seating out front and in the back, which was really nice. I enjoyed being able to get my own flask of water without having to bother the staff with it. Overall great atmosphere, friendly staff and our food arrived very quickly. 
We're glad we decided to be adventurous today, it paid off in spades and we will definitely be back.
author: Aaron K.

description: My first time there. Unfortunately the flavor profiles on the menu short. I had a $11 chicken souvlaki which was dry as well as the pita bread. Very little sauce and two chunks of orange through the whole thing. Staff was very nice!
author: Alison B.

description: Twice I went with friends there after work. Both times I ordered garlic fries(to share) and lamb salad. Delicious but of too big a portion for me. The deco and ambiance are quite hipster-ish, though one time when my girl friend pushed a baby stroller in, the staff was very accommodating.
author: Fang X.

description: Souvla makes delicious food and takes care to emphasize local organic ingredients in their dishes.  I love the veggie salad which is made with japanese sweet potatoes, organic romaine and kale, and topped with a creamy garlic-y dressing made with local organic dairy.  Learn more about Souvla's tasty dishes and ingredients at http://curiouseater.io/restaurants/souvla
author: Cara B.

description: Overrated.  The food is dry.  We ordered 3 meals, no drinks, including extra sauces on Caviar. The bill was $95.  We got a follow up email indicating that they would have to charge us an additional $1 plus fees because there was a special request for "extra sauce" on a sandwich.
author: Diana H.

description: I don't understand why this place is so popular. It's decent, but nothing special.  More importantly, it's a chain, and it feels like a chain. Logos on everything. So yeah, it's better than Applebee's but still, come on guys...
author: Nick A.

description: One of the best Greek restaurants in the city and the service is suuupeer fast! Highly recommended!
author: Carolina L.

description: Awesome food, friendly staff and fast service! They only have one meatless option (roasted sweet potato) but it's so good that I'm OK with that. Also, you're playing yourself if you don't try the Greek frozen yogurt here.
author: Lauren T.

description: Wonderful salads! Superb rotisserie chicken, Nice setting indoors and especially outdoors
author: Virginie F.

description: This place just did it for me.  Kind of a strange operation, where it feels semi fast food.  We sat outside in the back- the courtyard back there is cool and has a heater.  Grabbed some wine and the lamb salad bowl.  But what really knocked my socks off was the olive oil/salt/yogurt for dessert- very unique taste.  Their location in the Mission is great too
author: Charles C.

description:
We LOVE Souvla!  We used to frequent their Hayes Valley location, but it was more of a trek and parking isn't the best.  Ever since the NOPA location opened, we've exclusively been frequenting this location.  It's a little closer to home, and while parking STILL isn't the best, we manage.

My favorite salad is hands down (not just at Soulva, but my favorite salad in general) is their Mary's Free-Range Chicken Salad.  The flavorful chicken and the sweetness of the Navel Orange?  Yum!

I also love their Greek Fries.  We always add the Harissa spiked yogurt dipping sauce.  Adds a little extra kick to the fries.

This location is much bigger than the Hayes Valley one and we always manage to find a seat.  You can order online and pick up.  It's always super quick and everyone working here is really friendly.

YES!  We will definitely be back.
author: Kris L.

description: I really like this place. It is super small, but the food is great. Not many options, but everything is great. Casual, quick meal.
author: Jen G.

description: Nice indoor/ outdoor environment. Good food, but nothing special. A good place to grab a beer and quality fast food.
author: Kyla H.

description:
Just as good as the original Souvla in Hayes Valley + a great outdoor patio. I can't say enough good things about Souvla, the brainchild of the famous Kokkari and Evvia restauranteurs. 

You pick between 4 proteins - lamb, pork shoulder, rotisserie chicken, and sweet potato. You can have them as salads or as a gyro. I'm a huge fan of the lamb gyro and the chicken salad. Their fries and potatoes are delicious, and you can opt to get them in the wrap "Greek-style" for 50c more!

Their frozen yogurt has spoiled me from all other fro-yo places, so make sure you get those as dessert before you leave. This location is not quite as crowded as the Hayes Valley one, so the food comes out really quickly!
author: Kate M.

description:
Just as good as the Hayes Valley mother ship, which means the food is well-sourced, relatively inexpensive and tasty.

The egg-lemon soup with rice and chicken was wonderful and chock full of chicken.  Not the kind of chicken you get in canned soup but chicken.

The rotisserie chicken salad was enormous and perfect. A side order of potatoes with rotisserie drippings was also very good.

For one person I over ordered but enjoyed my meal.
author: David D.

description: I ordered Souvla from Caviar today. I was very excited to finally try them. I ordered juicy potatoes, chicken sandwich and lamb salad with pita. Food was fresh and good but after I ate about half of the pitas, I found two very suspicious-half-eaten-looking pita pieces. I was quite surprised about this, didn't want to believe they were little teeth marks on the pitas. My husband and I finished the salad but didn't eat the pitas. I wanted to believe they were just ripped out pieces but still... I don't want half broken pieces :( a bit disappointed. I would go to their restaurant to eat but probably never get their food delivered again.
author: Nana K.

description: I've loved Souvla's food since they opened their NOPA branch about a year ago. One of my fave neighborhood lunch spots. We decided to cater our summer backyard party over Labor Day with build your own chicken and lamb sandwiches or salads.  Yum, right? Well, the heat wave hit SF on Friday and two of the 3 Souvla walk ins fridges went down on Saturday. They had to close all 3 stores due to power outages and workers' heat exhaustion.  But Charles, Tony & Lauren still made our catering order happen - coming in especially to fulfill our order for 30 people. It was a smash hit! I would recommend using Souvla's catering - they are a great team to work with. Or just stop by and have a fantastic roasted meat salad or sandwich!!
author: Shannon M.

description:
Outstanding food. Get anything that has chicken; its the star of the show. Its on display when you walk in on the big rotisserie machine. The lamb and pork are meh imo, mayb they would taste better if they were too on rotisserie. 

I get the salad its got a pleasing mixture of greens, fruit, cheese, sauce, and meat. I get it 'greek style' which means they add a handful of fries ontop its only 50cents extra. 

Hot sauce is bomb. Food service is quick and prices are fair. It can be packed. I order online and its usually ready for pickup in 5 minutes.
author: Adam M.

description: I eat here at least once a week. A little expensive but at least it's got me eating salads. The salads have better value than the sandwiches in my opinion. I love the avgolemono soup and the frozen yogurt with baklava, salt and olive oil. The backyard makes this the best souvla location.
author: Brianna N.

description: I am not Greek; therefore, I do not have a Greek grandmother. But if I did, she'd be turning over in her grave at the sandwich I had! I am totally willing to pay for quality food, but I just can't get behind paying $13 dollars for a pita that tasted like chalk and dry lamb.
author: Alex C.

description: The chicken and lamb are dry and lack flavor. They also charge you $0.92 for any sauce you use, which would be totally fine if they were transparent about it and the sauce was actually good. The back patio is really nice on a sunny day but if you prioritize food over setting then skip Souvla and eat at all the other amazing places on Divisadero instead.
author: Hieu L.

description: Great place. Would definitely go there again. Selection is a bit limited in both drinks and food but it makes for very simple ordering. Wish they had a bit more seating. Other than that, it's the best Greek food I have had hands down.
author: Javier M.

description: Had a great chopped salad here. If you're looking for traditional Greek food or Greek street food this is NOT the place. However, the lamb salad was delicious and the fries were good too. Food came fast and was fresh. Atmosphere is casual and lively, but not very suitable for large groups.
author: R A.

description:
Writing this review while I'm still dreaming about the frozen Greek yogurt.

If this isn't already your go-to spot for casual dinner with a friend, then don't bother coming - I want to save this place all for myself! We stopped here around 8:30pm on a Tuesday night at had no issues finding a spot to sit. Both ordered the veggie salad with sweet potato and it is the BOMB. The white sweet potato is incredibly creamy and the olive oil dressing is light and tangy.The salad itself is huge so definitely enough to take home for lunch the next day.

The all-star favorite? Greek yogurt. The employees are really chill about mixing and matching flavors, so I'm a huge fan of the olive oil and sea salt w/ a slice of baklava. I need to look into the cost of getting a Souvla Greek yogurt machine installed in my apartment so that I can binge eat this stuff every day.
author: Anisha C.

description:
Love your food, but you guys NEVER EVER include utensils in your take out orders. I've ordered take out/delivery from this location about a dozen times and not once have I gotten a fork. It's a running joke at this point. 

Love them fries, though!
author: Victoria B.

description: This place is going downhill fast. Prices have increased, portions are smaller, and on my last visit they forgot to put olives and walnuts on the ingredients on the veggie salad so it was basically just potatoes, kale, and onions.
author: Ida P.

description: Amazing place for lunch. No waiting in line on a Friday early evening and the food came out within 7 mins. Service was great as well, thank you!
author: david g.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night with friends.

We ordered:
* chicken salad 
* pork salad
* baklava crumbles & honey syrup greek froyo

Price: ~$32 not including tip

The order line moved fast and the food came out in less than 6 minutes. Wow!

The salads come in big bowls--I thought it was well worth the price. I had trouble finishing my bowl.

Chicken Salad -- My friend got this and he gobbled it up in no time.
Pork Salad -- So...it was mostly good, but some of the chunks of pork were way too dry and stringy. The parts that were good were tender, flavorful and delicious. Overall, I thought this was a well proportioned salad with generous portions of meat.

Greek Froyo--it was a bit of a sweetness overload in the end. I wish it came in different sizes because I thought the cup was much too large. I thought it was delicious, but not particularly memorable and very similar to regular froyo places.
author: Yan F.

description:
Lamb sandwich, Greek style. 
Chicken salad. 
Rose house wine. 
Olive oil and sea salt Greek yogurt. 

These are my faves at Souvla. Yum.
author: Mag L.

description:
I love me a good gyro but I'm equally super happy when it's a bougied-up version like what they have here. It's good, big, and mmm mmm good.

I always get the lamb with a side of fries. All to share. My dude and I should probably get an extra order of fries though. Apparently our kid isn't dissuaded by the crumbled cheese and fought us for fries.  The lamb is thick, moist, and reminds me of the stewed meats of my youth. Sigh.

Share an entree. That way if you have any room left, you can squeeze in a froyo.
author: Loli L.

description:
Although I'm still bitter about losing Herbivore Souvla is definitely a solid addition to the neighborhood. 

I tried the Lamb Sandwich and side Chicken Salad and was pretty happy with the salad however the lamb was overcooked-- BAHHHhumbug. 

Really love they are sticking to their Greek roots w their all Greek wine/beer selection. I ordered the rose which was tasty and also an great value-- $10 for what seemed like 2+ cups. 

We ordered a Baklava Greek Yogurt w Cherry Sauce to go and it was seriously good and almost guilt free! Will be back fosho.
author: Lauren B.

description: I ordered take out for my family and overall we were all very pleased with the food but wouldn't recommend the Veg sandwich. One concern is that I ordered and paid for a side that I didn't receive and there is essentially no way to contact them to notify them of the mistake in order to receive a refund (unless I went all the way back to the location, which isn't ideal for anyone). Otherwise I highly recommend the lamb sandwich!
author: Al K.

description:
New champ for most over-rated joint on the Diviz corridor.  
I found the food either salty or bland.  and of course heavy.
Why would you ever go here when you can also just go over to Ragazza?
or Crudo
or Nopalito!
or 4505 Meats
or Little Star Pizza 
or ... ad infinitum..
author: Troy B.

description:
Be really cautious about ordering online. Two locations (Hayes Valley & NoPa) are very close to each other so it can get confusing when your ordering (this seems to happen to them regularly from what the cashiers said).

Once you order online and pay, there's no way of sorting it out, moving your order, or getting your money back.  Just double check! It doesn't help that they dont have any one answering a phone either.
author: Jayda S.

description:
The reviewers aren't lying when they say to get the Greek frozen yogurt with baklava and honey. Probably one of the most satisfying and delicious desserts out there for only $5! The yogurt is creamy and tart and a wonder in and of itself. The baklava just takes it to another delicious level! Be sure to order it and ask to pick it up at the conclusion of your meal. You will not be disappointed! 

I also had the Greek fries with their Granch and added some of their table provided hot sauce. So delicious and such a perfect little afternoon snack and appetizer to the yogurt! 

The back patio is quiet and gorgeous! I highly recommend grabbing a table back there if you can! 

Will absolutely come back! But before 530 as that's when the lines really started.
author: Jay K.

description: This place was very simple, a choice of salads or sandwiches and sides. I had the chicken salad which was chocked full of good ingredients. The chicken was also tender and blended well with the salad. All in all a nice place for a quick lunch.
author: Ian C.

description:
Nice place but a bit small, so be ready to wait if you want to stay. Not for big group.

Smell is delicious from the meats grilling. The potatoes with garlic and oil are a deadly sin! Oh my!
We took a salad with the lamb, and can only dream of the sandwich version of it. Next time?

A very good greek food place.
author: Fabrice L.

description:
The new Souvla on Divis is just as good as the Hayes Valley location, but closer to my house - yahoo!

Their menu is super simple, just choose your protein and either have it as a gyro sandwich or salad. My favorite thing to order is the chicken salad, though I am thinking I want to try the vegetarian sweet potato version next! All of the proteins are thoughtfully sourced, so you can eat them with a good conscience. Also, don't forget their amazing frozen greek yogurt dessert. The go-to is topped with baklava crumbles and honey syrup, though the sour cherry is delicious as well.

The outdoor patio here sets this storefront apart from their other location, as it provides extra seating and would be awesome on a sunny day (yesterday was breezy and cool, so we decided to stay indoors).

Again, I am super stoked to have Souvla (a little) closer to home - you can count me as a regular on Divis soon!
author: Liz G.

description: Super good food. It is a really cool spot to eat and chill. Food is delicious and very fresh. I recommend this place.
author: Kristine N.

description: Listen, I know it's absurd to spend $20 on a salad and potatoes but it's so good! I get the chicken salad and alternate between fries and roasted potatoes. Great portion size. And the froyo...geez...just spend the money and do it.
author: Tatum T.

description: Consistently solid food. Simple menu. I usually get the lamb sandwich for $13. A little pricey for what it is but it Is San Francisco. The wine is also overpriced for a limited if appropriate but uninteresting list.  This place is much bigger than the Hayes valley store so I've never had lines like I see there and there's a lovely back patio. That is a huge plus for me. In fact whenever I go down to 4505 BBQ and the line is too long, I just come here instead
author: David A R.

description: Go to Hayes location. This one is particular bad. Found the fries to be stale. Lamb was tough. I complained since I knew it should be better.  But just got a shrug.
author: Dan K.

description: Souvla always offers savory, large meals with great Mediterranean flavors. We got lamb salads, chicken sandwiches, and the soup. The soup tasted a little strange - perhaps because the taste is really strong. One of the potato orders had so much oil that it was bit tough to eat. However, the restaurant is beautiful, service is great, and the food is definitely above average and pretty unique!
author: Camilo O.

description:
We placed a fairly large to go order for work (4 salads, 8 sandwiches, and 6 frozen yogurts. There was a glitch with the pick-up time online but when we called the restaurant they happily corrected it.

Lamb salad was great and everybody else lived their food (lamb sandwiches and chicken salads). We all thought we would like the yogurt with baklava best but agreed the sour cherry was better! 

Great place for lunch! While $14 may seem expensive for a salad, it was huge with lots of lamb-definitely worth the price. The yogurt was fairly large and reasonably priced at $4/$5.

So glad to have Souvla close to Pac Heights :)
author: Rachel C.

description: I hate to be a hater, but it was time for Herbivore to either have a major make over or move along. I guess the latter happened only to be replaced by this gem. I had their chicken salad and I can't say enough good things about it except the portion size may be a tad to large! j/k on the size, but this could easily be shared and paired with another dish-- the lamb sandwich (on flat bread) would be perfect. The beer in blue bottles is palatable but, after the uber-hoppy stuff you find around town these days, takes some time to get used to. it's tough to find a seat, so be creative and friendly and mosey on up to any available space-- I'm sure they'll understand. Only really bummer is I'm going to gain weight because of this place.
author: Brian J.

description: Food was great but they laughed in my face when I asked for a high chair for my 1yo.
author: Ben Y.

description: This place never disappoints. Super fast service, delicious food with responsibly sourced meats...can't beat it. I've even had them deliver to an event I hosted and the food was spot on. Great portion sizes too. I'll definitely continue to recommend this place.
author: Leah M.

description:
as a Greek-American, I really wanted to try this place out when I stumbled upon it. the decor is clean and fresh and welcoming and the food looked good.. however the dark-haired cashier lady was so nasty when I asked about the Greek iced tea, rolling her eyes and struggling to answer my question, that I just walked out without ordering food.
hospitality is a big thing in the Greek culture and this employee did NOT represent that...
I couldn't help but notice that one of the chairs had my last name on the back I even tried asking the same woman what was the meaning behind that, but she seemed really annoyed and said she didn't know, before taking the next customer.
author: Ana J.

description: Awesome place in every way! Delicious salads and pita sandwiches (chicken sandwich-yum! And the vegetarian salad is amazing!), cool atmosphere (love the open back patio!), friendly staff and super fast service. And if you're walking by and just want a snack, try their awesome  Greek Fro-Yo. Yum!!
author: Hannah R.

description:
I was excited to try the second location of Souvla in my hood. The space is beautiful and clean, outdoor patio, and especially kind and professional staff. Unfortunately, the food did not hit the mark for us. Our sandwiches were doused in so much olive oil and sauce that it was borderline inedible, and I love yogurt sauce. Our plates were full of oil, and not in the good way. It was WAY too rich. I asked for a replacement of the breakfast sandwich for a chicken salad, and it was slightly better. It was presented beautifully, but kale needs some love before serving in a salad, so the texture was what one would expect with huge chunks of dry kale. 


I'd go back for fries and maybe to try their frozen yogurt. Again, kind people and amazing service. Just not my preferred style of Greek/Mediterranean.
author: Skye L.

description: Amazing salads. The vegetarian salad with sweet potato maybe one of the best salads I have ever had. The olives gave it the right amount of zest, better than vinegar. Awesome!
author: Mallika B.

description: Fantastic Greek food in a tiny space. Great for takeaway or dining in if you can snag a table. Their rotisserie chicken and chicken juice potatoes are excellent, but you can't go wrong with anything you order. Staff is friendly and service is quick as well.
author: Penny S.

description: I eat here at a couple times a month. Vegetarian salad is bomb. Potatoes are ridiculously delicious. All Greek yogurts rock -- the olive oil one is particularly special.
author: Currin B.

description: Love their wraps and salads. Their greek cherry soda drink is a nice small treat. We are repeat customers. They get busy and it can be hard to get a seat. Food is very fresh! The fries with what I think is mizithra cheese and yogurt mint dip is addicting!
author: M M.

description: I got their vegetarian salad and it was so yummy and filling (bc of the generous amount of sweet potato they put in)! I loved the outdoor seating area. The only mehhh part about souvla is the price but it's worth it, I think :)
author: Lori K.

description: The frozen greek yogurt with baklava was one of the best things I've ever had. And, the veggie salad was also unreal. Casual and delicious.
author: Brooke S.

description:
A Hayes Valley regular, I was excited to try their new place on Divis. It's a cookie cutter of the smaller location. I was hoping for an expanded Greek menu, how about some homemade hummus? And other truly Greek specialties? Instead, they are serving the exact same limited menu as Hayes, nothing new. 
The dining room is also the same, small cramped tables and communal seating. No intimidate dining experience to be had. The kitchen while overly large, detracts from the dining experience. Just like Hayes, I'd prefer to take away. 
And don't order your wine in metal cups, it adds a metallic taste in your wine. 
Hopeful they'll make necessary changes as their business evolves.
author: Giselle B.

description: Yelped this place for lunch on my way home from a memorial service.  Had the lamb salad and is was absolutely delicious.  A little crowded but friendly - a couple let me share counter seating with them outside.  Great food.  Casual.  Inexpensive.  Check it out.
author: Mike B.

description: The gyros are the best ever!  Love the back patio.  This is one of my favorite spots in San Francisco!
author: A n.

description: Very Delightful Brunch, had the soup, split a Lamb Salad, and opted for the Sour Cherry soda, Id highly recommend buying a sparkling water with the soda, your drink will last so much longer, also good if you want to split one drink. Also the garlic greek yogurt is the way to go with the fries. Everything was beyond what was expected, including the amount of meat in the Lamb Salad. Hope you Enjoy
author: Craig G.

description: Souvla is one of my go tos in the city. I love the simple menu and freshness of the food. Their chicken is my favorite.
author: Kelsey F.

description:
FROZEN GREEK YOGURT!!!!!! 
And rosè of course. 

The back patio is lovely and food arrives fast. My soup was cold once.. Meh I still ate it.
author: Rachael P.

description:
The food is awesome.

The atmosphere is great. 

Try the lamb it is local and slow roasted.
author: Shane M.

description: Delicious and healthy! The chicken and potatoes are super flavorful and the fries are awesome too!
author: Tina L.

description:
Amazing. 
I went for quick lunch and their lamb sandwich was the best i've ever had. 
Just enough juice on lamb and the whole combination of inside ingredients were well balanced. Perfect for quick food, but not for sit down for a while Mediterranean since they only have salad or sandwich. there is outdoor sitting which i thought was really cute too. In general, restaurant has great and clean interior with amazing food.
author: Sm Y.

description: Go to healthy, high quality salad spot. And the froyo with olive and sea salt is the perfect indulgence.
author: Katie A.

description:
It's great to have Souvla on Divisadero finally!  I loved going to this place in Hayes valley, and now I can walk to it in a couple minutes.  The food is great just like the original location and I like that the new space has more room.

My only gripe is the layout.  It's really confusing when you enter the restaurant.  A long narrow hallway connects the two parts of the restaurant.  The ordering area is crammed in this hallway so it creates a bottleneck quickly.

Overall, highly recommend this place.
author: JD R.

description: This new location is so awesome. The back patio is absolutely beautiful with the twinkley lights, and it feels a little more spacious than the other location. Not too fancy, but not too casual-- it's the perfect in between place. I recommend the lamb pita, or the lamb salad. And of course the Greek beer. Oh and the potatoes. Okay never mind just order the whole darn menu.
author: Martha P.

description:
i don't know what happened to souvla, with its original location being so successful in hayes valley, it's only exciting to try out the newer location on divisadero. however it was a let down.

there are 2 major things that went wrong with our recent experience. we can in for togo orders for lamb salad and chicken gyro sandwich.
