1. food: lamb salad was monotone when it comes to flavor. the only one note was "tangy" from all the pickled onions and dressing without good balance of other flavors in there, it would've been better to have a few sweet elements in there (for example, some pomegranate seeds to balance it out) . the lamb was also dry. chicken gyro was a disaster. albeit having more sweet elements in there, the shredded chicken was really dry. but the interesting part was the disturbingly huge amount of chicken fat that was dripping out from the bottom of the gyro into the box when we're eating it. still couldn't get our heads wrapped around how the chicken could be so dry to taste but massive amount of chicken grease was escaping from the other end. it was unappetizing.

2. safety: the chicken gyro had a thin wish bone left in there. in the midst of eating, my partner pulled out a long, roughly 2 inch long thin chicken bone that was left in the shredded meat. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. can you imagine if he had swallowed the bone and it lodged in his throat? this is purely bad quality control on the restaurant's end and you really NEED TO be more thorough with deboning and shredding your meats. SCARY!

all in all, it was such a let down, would've given a 1 star, but another star goes to the friendly service staff with smiles on their faces. all in all, horrible food and will not return to to location.
author: Joyce C.

description: So far, I've tried the chicken "sandwich"--it's in a gyro wrap, the parmesan fries and the potato salad. I liked the chicken sandwich and the fries the first time I visited this place. I went back shortly after because I went to a work get together there and I had the potato salad.The potato salad was really good and I'm not even vegetarian. You will have to like sweet potatoes though--if you don't like sweet potato, you will not like the salad. Besides the yummy sweet potatoes, their dressing is soo good, I will have to try to look of the recipe and make it myself because this place is far from where I live. There is also kale and pickled onions and other stuff. Their salad portion is big, you will leave full/ satisfied if you order one. A must try! I'll have to try the other salads next time. My mouth is watering!
author: Myra H.

description: Nice atmosphere along with a cute patio area in the back. I got a chicken pita for lunch and overall was not impressed. The chicken was very tough, almost impossible to chew. My sandwich was dry after just the second bite. I felt they probably used yesterday's meat in my sandwich. Vegetables in the sandwich were of good quality but was mainly disappointed in the quality of the meat.
author: Megan G.

description: Yes. Yes. And more yes. 6 words. Chicken Salad with White Sweet Potato.  Don't forget the soft serve. Baklava for the win.
author: Justin P.

description: Best lamb sandwich of my life!
author: Katie C.

description: This is delicious simple Greek food. It has an easy menu (e.g. salad or pita with meat or veg options) and is incredibly affordable! The ambience is lovely with tables in the back outside too - it's especially nice considering it's an inexpensive place but there is always a long line so it can be hard to get a table. Of course, tart yogurt soft serve is also delicious there
author: Ron M.

description: I've had the chicken and lamb sandwiches.  Meat is well seasoned and cooked, not over done.  The fries are good too.
author: David C.

description: This place is awesome. Simple but tasty sandwiches with Greek taste. The menu is pretty limited what makes decision making easy. As well they have Mediterranean wines and beers. Also they have rozen Greek yogurt. Sometimes there is line at the entrance. If you want to avoid it I would recommend going during off hours. But this location is new so less crowded than Hayes one. Highly recommend this place. Food is excellent and the atmosphere is lively and casual.
author: Kate Y.

description: It was a very good surprise. The food is very good and the environment very pleasant and clean.
author: Leonardo S.

description: My husband and I are obsessed with Souvla - the food, simple menu and atmosphere! We drive an hour from the East Bay just to satisfy our cravings! We love the chicken salad and lamb sandwich. We usually order a side of the roasted sweet potato to share. Wish there was a location in the East Bay! We'd be there all the time.
author: Erica P.

description: Souvla always does a great job, they've mastered their limited menu; so everything tastes great.
author: Tal E.

description: Incredible lamb and pork salad!! So fresh, so clean, and the same can be said for the design of the restaurant.
author: Alice N.

description: Souvla on Divis!!!  Gorgeous restaurant with beautiful flower arrangements with outdoor dining area with wonderful people cooking, greeting and serving you good eats.  Lots of green leaves - so beautiful.   On weekends, Souvla makes a breakfast wrap that is just delicious with eggs, cherry tomatoes, avgolemono sauce, with your choice of rotisserie meat or yellow sweet potatoes!  SO HAPPY you're here, welcome to the neighborhood!!
author: Wakako U.

description:
Amazing chicken salad and the potatoes cooked in the rotisserie chicken drippings were delicious. Super fast and quick, and very healthy food. You can order the actual rotisserie chicken to take home after 6pm.
I'll definitely be coming back to try the lamb and the pork - such an amazing find!
author: Azella P.

description: The salads are amazing, I usually get the chicken salad. The french fries are crispy  and also a crowd favorite when I have gone with friends. Decent amount to share between two people. And the best part is you can order your Greek yogurt dessert and bring your ticket back up to the cashier and they will make it for you when your ready.  There is usually a long line so, place your order for pick-up and they text  you when it's ready, you can walk right up to the front!
author: Thomas R.

description: Oh Souvla, I really want to love you.  I absolutely love Greek cuisine and healthy food to boot so this should be my dream match .  However after several visits, I am still not thrilled.  I tried the veggie salad and pork salad 2 times AND the lamb sandwich. I chalk this up to the fact that I really do not like overwhelming amounts of fat in my meat, which I think some people do.  This isn't a sarcastic comment - I know people do.  I even read another comment which talked about how they LOVE the fattiness of the pork.  I, however, prefer actual meat. Further, the prices are a bit steep.  Tonight I ordered a salad for me, sandwich for my husband and side of fries and it was $35.  Yikes.  That said, because I really want to love it....I think I will give it one more try and try the chicken.  I do love the frozen yogurt and they give you a big portion with yummmmmy olive oil and salt.
author: Coco L.

description: Taste of Greece in SF. They have the best bowls. My favorite being the roasted chicken bowl with navel oranges, red onions, and mizithra cheese tossed with kale and lettuce. The staff is very welcoming and customer service is amazing. Make sure to also try their Greek yogurt with baklava and honey.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: Did you ever think you could actually love eating a salad? The chicken salad here are Souvla is just to die for, I never though a salad could be so satisfying. Everything here is fresh, delicious and unique. The perfect greek restaurant.
author: Kelly P.

description: I've been a fan of Souvla since when they first opened Hayes valley location. Fast but delish food, Divis one has a backyard to sit under the sun while stuffing my face with yummy lamb salad!
author: Beril Y.

description:
I've tried the lamb and chichen dishes at two of their locations.    I really wanted to like the sandwiches,  but unfortunately they really aren't my cup of tea.  They were just ok.

   The pulled chicken sandwich had too much chicken.   I liked the orange and fennel but would like to see even more items inside the sandwich.  I definitely recommend checking them out since so many people like the food. 

 Also I tried their bottled Greek ice tea. Way too sweet for my taste since I prefer unsweetened ice tea.  Convenient locations, street parking.
author: Eleanor L.

description: Great lunch spot! The salads are filling and the wine pours are heavy. The outdoor patio is a perfect spot for some fresh air as well.
author: Emily B.

description: They don't even have fucking Gyros! I thought this was a Greek restaurant, what the hell is going on?
author: David S.

description: So happy this restaurant opened next to my apartment!  They've pretty much kept the same layout as Herbivore but opened up the back to outside patio seating which I absolutely love!  The items on the menu are simple but delicious and come in pretty big portions.  I've tried the lamb and chicken salads so far and man are they on POINT.  Expect a line but it goes by pretty fast and there plenty of seating - inside and out.  Can't wait to try the Greek yogurt!
author: Mei W.

description: So happy they came to the neighborhood! Simple and good! I'm a vegetarian and I'm obsessed with the salads! (Wraps are worth a try too!) The Greek frozen yogurt is a must! You can order to-go or sit down in the trendy backyard. This location seems bigger than the Hayes valley one so you can eat inside and not fight for a table! Only downside is they are around the block, so I will be eating there way more than I should ;)
author: Caitlyn B.

description: So good!!  Love the setup, love the menu, love the food, love the outdoor space.  We went early in the night with our kid and there were lots of young families, though I'm sure the scene changes later.  The food was excellent and I'm looking forward to eating it again.  I had the chicken over salad and my husband had the lamb over salad.  Both great.  Our son had the chicken soup which was also very good.  The drinks are just OK, though the wine pours are generous so that helps!  Can't wait to go back and try the frozen Greek yogurt!
author: Jill G.

description: This place has a nice patio in the front and back which is perfect on a sunny day. Everything is good but the lamb salad is a standout!
author: Molly N.

description: YASS Souvla- I praise their delicious salads and frozen yogurt. Even though I am a meat lover, their vegetarian salad is my absolutely favorite. It's a great bang for your buck because the left overs can serve as a snack or an extra meal. All fresh ingredients, all served consistently. Also, the frozen yogurt with wildflower honey is a delight.
author: Margie S.

description: Chicken is so so so dry. Such a disappointment. The lamb looked good though. The frozen Greek yogurt was okay. The olive oil and salt is a cool topping, but the yogurt itself doesn't taste significantly different from tart frozen yogurt from any other froyo joint.
author: Shawna C.

description: I came here for the first time and it was just the perfect spot for an easy, hearty, and wholesome meal. The menu is simple which makes it super easy to decide. I loved the vegetarian option in a salad. It was so good and filling! I will definitely return.
author: Leyla A.

description: Let's be real: the lamb tastes like my fellow Mexixans handled it in the kitchen -- not bad, totally edible, just not what I was expecting at a self-proclaimed Greek spot. Also, why are there no trash cans anywhere. Caters to one-note so-cal palette I think.
author: Natalie K.

description: Quick good Greek food. We had the soup and a lamb sandwich. The soup base was so lemony and savory. So good! The atmosphere is really enjoyable with many seating options. We went outside and enjoyed the warmth of the heaters against the foggy coolness. Very neat and clean. Excellent option when you're touring the area and need a fast but good bite to eat.
author: Louise R.

description: Amazing amazing place! Beautiful back patio with nice heaters. The "sandwiches" (gyros) are delicious. I've had the chicken and pork. Service is great and very accommodating! Yummy wine with generous pours. And don't get me started on the BACLAVA honey Greek fro yo!!! I went last night and I think I'm going back tonight!
author: Jessica V.

description: Stoped by for lunch of excellent Greek lemon / rice chicken soup.. comfort food! My friend had the lamb salad and a Greek beer. We sat in the sunny back yard. A simple ordering system and very nice remodel show care for customers and the food is fresh and delicious. Also roasting whole chickens so we can come back for dinner menu.
author: Helen M.

description: This place rocks!! Love their chicken sandwich and baklava crumble frozen yogurt! Be patient, frequent long lines at peak hours.
author: Rodney D.

description: This is a great place any night of the week. The food is good and reasonably priced, the staff is incredibly friendly, and the fro-yo is out of this world.
author: Parker W.

description: After reading reviews order food through caviar. Food came 40 minutes late then expected time extremely cold and were missing 2 items out of 5. Ok let's forget that for a second. Veggie wrap was bland and my wife actually threw it away completely inedible. I had lamb and it was unseasoned and nothing close to what you call Mediterranean food. I had some of the best shawarma's in Bay Area & in NYC and this place falls way way below the expectation.
author: Steve S.

description: Everything was delicious, we had the pork and the lamb sandwich (real Gyros), with fries and for dessert the yogurt with baklava soooo yummy
author: Natalia E.

description: So stoked to come back for two days in a row. You can choose in a small but well-done menu. Proteins in the form of spit-fired very healthy chicken is so good! Go-to
author: Giovanni M.

description: Ate here for the first time. Very clean restaurant, minimal decor, narrow space with different types of seating. Order food at the counter they give you a number and bring food quickly. I had the Greek soup lemony, shredded chicken with rice. Very good, flavors all worked well together. Also ate the vegetarian salad with kale, romaine, walnuts, good dressing. Had a Greek cheese shredded not feta. It was good too. For dessert we had Greek yogurt sundae. The flavor of the yogurt was very tangy, quite nice. It had crumbled baklava, I did not like that. Food was reasonably priced, soup $6, salad $11. If I was in that area again I would like to try other things on the menu.
author: Gale M.

description: This is one of my favorite places in SF. They have an inside room, which is under the sky and surrounded with trees, I would recommend seating there. The menu here is very simple, they have something like 10 choices. Salads are very big, they have also a tasty soup, but I especially like the burritos of lamb here. The prices are a little high, but it worth it.
author: Gegham V.

description: Fantastic! The chicken salad was absolutely perfect and unique. The chicken pita was juicy with every bite. Clean, friendly and trendy decor. Can't wait to try the Greek yogurt soft serve!
author: Shelby M.

description: Souvla is a quick, place to grab lunch or dinner. Perhaps it isn't super traditional, but I don't even really consider it to be Greek. More of a sandwich and salad spot. Yes, it is a little pricey for what it is, but it's good quality and the portions are good size. I like the chicken pita best. And for when I want to be a little healthier, the chicken salad. I've had the pork pita which once I loved, the other time it was extremely porky tasting (if that makes sense). The french fries are to die for. So so good and seasoned perfectly. I've had the chicken soup, which I like to get when I feel like I am fighting a cold. You know it's made with all those chicken parts they have leftover. Greek Yogurt Baklava is also an interesting, tart dessert.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Cute little spot perfect for a yummy lunch date. It was just what my friend and I were looking for as we were exploring the area. The salads were delicious and the fries were great too! We sat in the outside area that was so adorable!!
author: Anna R.

description:
Bummed. I've always loved this place. I used to always go to the one in Hayes Valley when it first opened up a few years ago. I've moved closer to the Nopa location, so I walked over and ordered the Chicken Salad (my favorite!) to go. 
They brought me my order promptly... they were about to close, so I'm guessing he kitchen was working hard to get orders out quick. I do appreciate the speedy turnaround, and said so to the guy who delivered my food. But when I looked down at the box, and it was marked "lamb sandwich"... so I stopped the guy who gave it to me and told him I thought it was the wrong order. He told me, "no, that's a chicken salad, we just reused the box." Um, okay? The box honestly looked a little dinged up, and in hindsight, I wish I'd asked for a fresh one. But, I took out my reuse-able bag and charged onward. 
I think they've changed their recipe for the yogurt dressing to be less yogurt and more olive oil. By the time I got to eat my salad, it tasted far more bland than I remember... of course, that may be because by the time I'd walked the few blocks back home, the gently used box had come apart at the seams and my dinner was pouring out of the box into a pool of olive oil in my bag. 
The whole experience was disappointing. I used to really like that place. Please don't cut corners on that delicious yogurt dressing. Please only use boxes once. 
I'm still giving 2 stars bc I like that they use organic chicken. (They still do, right?)
author: Lauren S.

description: After eating Souvla Divisadero food twice, I am afraid I cannot think of a single reason not to give them five stars. Great pork; super avgolemono; wonderful sauces and fries...all reasonable! The simple menu and the fact that they are steps from my front door doesn't hurt...love the new location!
author: Valerie H.

description: Great atmosphere. Delicious food. Make sure to get the frozen Greek yogurt. There's usually a small line during peak hours but it goes quickly and the staff are helpful and friendly.
author: Arel O.

description: Yummy lamb sandwich and frozen yogurt with backlava crumbs!  Backyard patio is great.
author: Caryn S.

description: Awesome food but please tell us up front, literally up front, when the entire back patio is reserved on a Friday night. It's a bit uncool to let your customers wait in a long line to order to then learn that there is no seating out back. Or inside for that matter.
author: heidi h.

description:
I don't want to give it 5 stars, because I don't want the line to get longer.

It is really the best, small simple menu, fresh ingredients, quality food. Great go to. Can't go wrong with Chicken, Lamb, or Pork. Salads are the best.

Try it, you won't be disappointed!
author: Joe D.

description: Holy moly I cannot describe how greasy this food is. My friend ordered the chicken wrap and I got the pork wrap - expecting and wanting healthy eats. The grease and oil POURED out of my wrap - into a puddle on my tray, a puddle on my leg, and a puddle in my hair. My friend ended up with an oil spill on his tray. For this amount of money, I would rather deep fry myself at home for $2.
author: Pamela Y.

description: So excited to have Souvla open up on divis! Everything here is amazing and the staff is always friendly and attentive. It's bigger than the first location and has a beautiful back patio just in time for summer. My favorites are the kale chicken salad, Greek fries and of course the frozen Greek yogurt ! The food is just as good as the first location.
author: Madeline H.

description: It tastes (and feels) as if I was getting my lamb salad and frozen yoghurt in Greece by the Mediterranean!
author: Adeyemi A.

description: Souvla is hot fire. Come here and eat away the calories you just burned at soul cycle. Only here can you feel trendy and shove a fat chicken/veggie/lamb pita in your mouth with hot sauce dropping down your face but your loving every minute of it. The fries are scrumcious and the wine is on point.
author: Rohan S.

description: The best salad in SF. The meats are delicious and fresh off the rotisserie. Juicy potatoes are super flavorful. Amazing French fries and soup. Highly recommend Souvla!
author: Jonathan S.

description: Bam! So spot on. Pork sandwich, salad with chicken, french fries--everything was hot, fast, and flawless. New space is beautiful. Grab a seat on the outdoor patio in the back if you can! Don't forget to save room for some greek fro yo.
author: Stephen C.

description:
A girlfriend took me here for the first time and I have gone back several times since. They have some of the best salads I've eaten in a while. Their chicken is so flavorful!  The menu is pretty simple and straight forward-I really appreciate that. A great space and clean atmosphere. 

One of their best asset is Joe I must say!! I was in a rush to pick up a whole chicken (can pick up after 6pm only!) I ordered that morning and had parked illegally. After walking in and seeing a line of people waiting to order, I cringed.  As I passed the line to the pick up area, I spotted Joe and he helped me right away. The chicken was not quite ready but Joe offered to call me when it was ready, cared that I can get a parking ticket, and eventually just brought it out to my car. Even asked if I needed help getting out of the tight parking job I was in! Now I don't expect this above and beyond service from anywhere but when you get it and in times when it counts, man it feels great-I just have to give him a shout out!! Thanks JOE!!! You made my day with your wonderful service and just being an awesome person! Management-you need to keep this guy and give him a raise! This type of staff is what sets you guys apart from other good spots in town.
author: Valerie L.

description: Lamb was either over cooked or served with big chunks of fat....neither being very desirable. This was not the case when this location first opened. The yogurt however is amazing but not sure I'd try the lamb again. Last time I had the chicken sandwich which was good but a little bland for my taste.
author: Ailene C.

description: Both here and the Hayes valley location offer a simple and delicious take on Mediterranean sandwiches and salads. It tastes like every ingredient and sauce has been home made and apportioned just right. They have a simple menu, reas I've had the chicken salad and pork knuckle sandwich and loved them both.
author: Luke S.

description: So glad they have opened on Divisadero. Half the distance as the Hayes spot. The menu is the same but the dining and ordering space is much improved. There are many table options including both front and back patios. Will be here weekly. They occupy the space formerly of Herbivore, but won't mention what closed then down, since this place looks so clean and new :).
author: mike w.

description: Incredible food! Healthy and light but very satisfying. One of my new favorite spots. Recommend getting there a bit early before the lunch crowd.
author: T. C.

description: Happy that the new location opened up on Divis. Went to check it out recently and was struck by how much roomier it is than the Hayes location. Nice outdoor seating area both in front on the sidewalk as well as in the back patio (although it was closed when we went because they were installing heat lamps). The inside has some large communal tables in the front and some 4-person high tops along a narrow hallway towards the back. Menu is more or less the same as the Hayes place. Try the lamb wrap, fries and garlicky Greek yogurt dressing. And don't forget the Greek froyo for dessert! My only complaint is that we (a group of 4) had to stand around for 10-15 minutes waiting for a table after placing our order, and there were several groups of 2 lingering at the 4-person tables long after their plates had been cleared. On the flip side, service is fast - our orders were ready while we were still standing and waiting for a table! In short, I'd definitely come back here for a date night or get-together with friends, although I might come at an off-hour to avoid the dinner rush.
author: J L.
